While all your physical surroundings are wonderful its your personalised service that sets you apart from any hotel I have ever stayed in

title: Great Staycation!!!
desc: Most famous hotel in Singapore and for a time it was looking shabby. After the renovations it is back to its former glory!!! Grand entrance makes you feel like royalty and the staff treat you like royalty. We did a staycation with government coupons which brought the price down...Singapore hotels are very expensive!!! And we had a great time. What did we love about it? The grand entrance, the rooms and the bakuteh they serve here is the best!!! If the government does another campaign, we will stay here again!!!

title: A dream come true
desc: The hotel has always been on my bucket list and it exceeded all expectations,a fabulous experience ,the staff are very caring,friendly,and extremely helpful, The Suite was amazing,fabulous bathroom and the bed was very comfortable as was the linen,and the lovely butler. Lovely restaurants,the Long Bar a special experience,and looking around the wonderful hotel with so much style and so well cared for was great Simply the best hotel I have ever been in

title: The best hotel in Singapore
desc: Having stayed at various 5-star hotels in Singapore, we find Raffles is the best hotel yet. The room we stayed in is very roomy, and very well appointed after the renovation. Service is definitely the highlight. Everyone remembers your name, and all needs were attended to. Please book a historic tour with Roslee, who is amazing. We will find it hard to stay at any other hotels in Singapore post our experience.

title: Excellent experience
desc: Excellent service, very comfortable stay. We had our wedding banquet here and extended another day of hotel stay. The entire process from check in to check out was very convenient, we also appreciate the commemorative photo given to us after check in, as well as the welcome Singapore Sling and the high tea at the grand lobby. I also appreciate that when we requested for our food to be cleared from the room, upon our return, I noted that the housekeeping staff had tidied up the rest of the room as well. Another positive point: we were at the courtyard suite and our neighbour happened to be a heavy smoker (who really enjoyed smoking outside). But surprisingly, we were unable to smell any smoke at all in our room so long as we close the doors. In other hotels I usually would have

title: Fantastic Experience and Hospitality
desc: I would like to personally thank Allen (Raffles Concierge /Front Desk Staff), for his first class hospitality, in this Iconic Hotel here is Singapore. "Great location in the heart of Singapore" "Long Bar - Definitely worth a visit" Thanks agin Ashleigh Hopkins

title: Amazing wedding event stay!
desc: The service from the Raffles team was exceptional. Our day ran smoothly without any stress and the level of communication and attentiveness was perfect. Fabulous experience on such an important day where it could have been stressful.

title: fabulous stay
desc: Impressed by the detail paid to each request and quick response. Staff decorated the room with balloons and birthday card for my wife's birthday. Clean and sprinkling toilet. Butler experience is excellent. You feel good at the moment you step out of driveway with a helpful valet and doorman Value for money stay

title: High Tea and a Singapore Sling
desc: High Tea - we didn’t stay at the hotel but did attended the high tea. At 42 years old, it was my first high tea and it was as fancy as I was expecting. Desserts were so pretty, champagne (Billiecart Salmon Rose) was amazing, Green Tea (jasmine) was delicious. The service was exceptional! After the High Tea we walked around the grounds and it was all so pretty. Went for a Singapore sling at the bar. That was an experience also. Peanuts on the table and shells on the ground. Place was packed and the Singapore Sling was worth the $82 for 2.

title: Exceptional Service
desc: Excellent service. Well located to all transport options. Staffs attention to detail exceptional. Butler service by Amanda, and team was outstanding. She was always available to assist with all our needs. Amanda always goes above and beyond the call of duty, a specially to make my birthday special. Her service and friendly nature is refreshing. Hotel well presented and all staff within the complex very polite.

title: Good Start of the Stay
desc: Very good and attentive service from the concierge/front desk upon arrival that made a good start of our stay. Good location with very easy access to get around. Very, very convenient to get drinks, food and shopping.

title: Another amazing stay at Raffles Singapore
desc: Another amazing stay at Raffles Singapore and it just keeps getting better. From the moment we were met at the airport and swiftly taken to Raffles where we were greeted by Patrick (the charming manager), front office staff and iconic doorman, I knew this stay would again be special. We were made to feel like we were arriving home, although one can only dream of a home like the historic luxury palace that Raffles is, truly an old dame, constantly reminding of a bygone colonial era, whilst enrobing you in luxury with appropriate technology, facilities, service and hospitality of the highest level. We were lucky enough that our friends at Raffles had an amazing suite available so were upgraded to accommodation that would not be out of place on a list of the best hotel suites in

title: Classic Afternoon Tea at Lobby Lounge
desc: The sandwiches, scones and sweets for the afternoon tea tasted average but fell short of expectations given the high price. Service was also slow and we had to remind another waiter that we were waiting for the additional scones after 15min of waiting. Overall, it felt overpriced.

title: Perfection!
desc: It hardly feels necessary leaving a review for such an iconic hotel when it already has a superb reputation but it really is as good as we expected and probably actually exceeded our expectations! So perfect - really worth a visit. Staff are incredible. Rooms are beautiful. Setting is amazing. Restaurant are brilliant etc. etc.!!

title: Amazing services
desc: Stress free, from arrival to departure as well as the dining experience. Our butler amanda make sure that we have the best experience staying at raffles hotel. My son loves toys and he recommended the special store for him. The dining experience was fabulous.

title: Lives up to the hype
desc: We were impressed by our stay at the Raffles Hotel. Prior to check in, a helpful phone call was received to ask what time we would check in, whether any special occasion was being celebrated and what in – room amenities would be needed. We were greeted enthusiastically upon arrival. Except for the Tiffin Room (see below) genuine warmth was observed all round from driveway staff to reception, the butlers, room attendants and the gym attendant. The suite was well renovated and fully stocked with everything we had requested. The butler was easily reached over the phone and all requests were taken care of in a courteous and timely manner. Breakfast food at the Tiffin Room was delicious with Mee Goreng (fried noodles) being the outstanding dish. That said, the staff at the Tiffin

title: More than a hotel stay.
desc: Was there to celebrate our wedding anniversary and wow. Definitely it was the right choice we made. Raffles hospitality started way before our check in date. Was in constant contact with Rina via email who was amazing. Replies were always positive and quick, some even within the hour. It really elevates the trust in me that's we are going to be well taken care of during our stay. Vanessa from the lobby team gave us a call a day before check in to brief us regarding our privileges and packages. It was informative and we knew they are ready to welcome us. Check in day was a breeze. Was greeted by Sudar and team. They assisted us promptly with our luggage and valet park our car. Vanessa and crystial did our phototaking and then in a jiffy, we are in our suite for check in. Both

title: Beyond our very high expectations.
desc: 4 nights of opulence in a unique piece of history that is now in the heart of a stunning city. An oasis of relaxed elegance that I had hoped would be as good as the legend and was actually better. Our Courtyard Suite was well worth the upgrade price and we pre booked breakfast for our holiday and this was also exceptional. We had afternoon tea 1 day as it was a special occasion and I would recommend this as well. The atmosphere is very laid back with most guests in either tourist or business attire. The staff are plentiful, delightful and are a real part of the whole experience. The ladies in their stunning dresses seem to float around the building. There was a head of state visit whilst we were there but this had no impact on the other guests. Our once in a lifetime

title: Unforgettable experience.
desc: We had dinner in the Tiffin room( Indian cuisine). The food and service was exceptional. Special thanks to Rohan and Jefferson for providing an unforgettable experience. Apart from the service, the combination of flavours was sublime. Also thanks to Selvam(manager) for the invitation.

title: Everything you ever expected
desc: Sadly on this occasion it was only a two-night stay, but it was everything we had anticipated and we were not disappointed. We were made very welcome at check-in and throughout our stay. Our courtyard suite was simply faultless, the food and service was perfect.

title: Such a treat!
desc: What an institution that has enormous reputation and it delivered in the grandeur of the buildings, the warm and approachable staff, comfortable rooms and fabulous facilities. Location is brilliant. For shopping and for the MRT. Our stay was such a treat and memorable experience.

title: Step back in time with beautiful service
desc: We had a 2 day stop over in Singapore and as it was my first time I had to have high tea at the Raffles. It didn't disappoint. Exceptional service with divine food. You need to experience this once in a lifetime event. Bookings are needed but it was over busy. We had the add on of bubbles, cause why not. But tea is included. I felt very felt very elegant and the service was next to none, even including a stool for my handbag :) I had the additional Maori Blue Tea that was amazing and cool it is from the Waikato, NZ.

title: Afternoon Tea / Long Room
desc: Raffles Hotel - Singapore We can now take afternoon tea and a drink at the long room at Raffles Hotel off the bucket list. Afternoon tea is a wonderful experience in relaxed and sumptuous surroundings. We elected to start with a glass of French champagne, followed by daintily cut sandwiches and rich mini cakes over Mariage Ferers tea. The highlight was the staff and their attentiveness to ensuring a pleasurable afternoon. The tea, in my case the earl grey was the best tea I have ever tasted and added enormously to our enjoyment. Tea at Raffles is an expensive experience and while we really enjoyed it and have no regrets, it may be worthwhile comparing alternatives such as the Fullerton Hotel, unless off course it is also on your bucket list. A drink at the long bar is a

title: A great place to spend an anniversary. Loved the experience, history and the small touches like a framed personal photo.
desc: Deserves its world ranking, very well preserved, loyal and experienced staff and otherwise a great place to spend some time. We thought the little touches like remembering our names through your visit by the lobby and restaurant staff was nice, so was the photos they took and they even had one framed in our bedroom of us. Will certainly return

title: Luxurious stay at Raffles
desc: An expensive but luxurious stay at this historic and iconic hotel. A truly fabulous suite and beautiful amenities. The butler-served Singapore slings, Writers Bar and Million Dollar cocktails are a must.

title: Stunningly beautiful hotel
desc: This hotel is probably the most beautiful spot and building in Singapore. Spacious, beautifully designed rooms, impeccable service. Delicious food, be it at breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea, or dinner. We also very much enjoyed the rooftop pool. While we were a bit disappointed by the city and its attraction, the Raffles has definitely exceeded our expectations.

title: The benchmark against which all should be measured
desc: Staying at Raffles in Singapore is not just staying at any hotel. It’s an insight into what true luxury and hospitality should be. From the moment you arrive to the sad time you leave, you’re made to feel special. The suites are exceptionally well equipped with tech thanks to the recent major renovations. The staff are warm and friendly. The breakfast was delicious and they cater well for gluten free requirements. The gf pancake recipe could be improved with the use of buckwheat flour rather than rice flour, but apart from that the breakfast was excellent. Taking the history tour with the resident historian Nazim gave us a wonderful insight to the treasures of the hotel and some of the events which had occurred over its long history. Raffles is an experience, not just a

title: Very Nice
desc: Stayed here for many times. Everything remain the same. Room is good, clean and well maintained. The breakfast also good and had a lot of choices. All staff welcome me and offering help. Thank you, will be back again!

title: Lovely Hotel
desc: Such a beautiful, historical hotel in Singapore. Well maintained and the surroundings are very calming . The hotel gives a classy feel and the grounds are simply lovely. Lots of plants and trees adds to the beauty of this place. A hotel worth visiting!

title: Great place
desc: We had a great time me and my family enjoyed it. Especially the kids. Thanks to the them for the great service, my children enjoyed a lot. The place is very refreshing and relaxing. After long time we could spend an amazing time as family. We will definitely come back.

title: Amazing Hotel
desc: 100% satisfied, highly recommend staying at the Raffles Singapore. Amazing hotel, great staff and service. Grounds of the hotel are unique and the beautiful gardens add to the experience, which is unlike a normal 5 star hotel in the middle of a major city. Breakfast was excellent. We also ate at the following Raffles restaurants, in order of our rating -Butchers Block (best) -Tiffin -Yi -Osteria Although all were very good. The hotel historical tour is a must and was one of the highlights of our stay. Our guide Roslee's knowledge of the hotel was incredible and his passion for the Raffles inspiring. We will be visiting again soon!

title: Impeccable
desc: Staying at Raffles has been a long held dream, and my two night stay with my daughter was a very special treat indeed. The ‘Grand Old Dame’ lived up to her reputation in every possible way. Service and presentation, decor and attention to detail where perfectly luxurious and yet somehow subtle and discreet. I doubt that I will ever be lucky enough to venture beyond the publicly accessible areas of the hotel again - but I will always have a special place in my heart for Raffles.

title: Classic Style
desc: From arrival until departure our expectations were surpassed at every level. The initial greeting from the grand doorman Harpreet (Happy) was warm and sincere. All staff led by Patrick Fisher were outstanding at every point. We had some issues with our experiences provided by BA. If it had not been for the persistence and expertise of the Concierge service ( Saddiq and Hafiz) we would not have been able to attend either of our planned excursions. They went above and beyond to assist us. At the front desk Qing Hui could not have been more helpful and efficient. At one stage our flights looked like they would be cancelled but Qing Hui quickly ensured that if that was the case then we would not have to worry about anything. The hotel is Classic and Stylish with every modern

title: A delightful stay.
desc: Hotel is situated right in the city, with various landmark close by. The hotel room is very comfortable. We had also booked dinner at La Dame de Pic, which was excellent. Loved the sumptious breakfast too.

title: Just a lovely Hotel especially the staff
desc: The hotel is beautiful and what we expected the staff are terrific and very attentive. We dined at 2 restaurants within Raffles and food was excellent as was the Service. The Butlers were exceptional.

title: Service of great quality
desc: Amazing hotel full of stories. Incredible background and design. Crew is perfect and Id say a huge THANK YOU to Allen. This person works with his heart and is particularily sensitive to the customiser s need. He brought us a very important help for someone in our group that needed a wheelchair. Allen took care of us, gave several calls for us to London Taxis. He got us precious help and information for the customer who couldn t walk.

title: Highlight of my life, best hotel stay ever.
desc: What a wonderful experience from start to finish, every detail was taken care of. Staff worked ‘above and beyond ‘, nothing was too much trouble. The atmosphere created throughout Raffles was amazing and smiles infectious, if you could bottle it, it would be priceless. Raffles staff helped me celebrate special events and were very caring to me in my recent grief. They made my time there so special and gave me beautiful memories. I have stayed at many hotels across the world and nothing come close to the standards set by Raffles. Well done Raffles. Carol Nixon and family.

title: A wonderful Experience
desc: Someone once said …” When you visit Raffles be sure to make time to see Singapore”….a meaningful summary of our experience staying at Raffles 22-27th August 2022. We thoroughly enjoyed the high-quality experience and attentive service we received upon arrival through to departure from every member of staff. You are made to feel a uniquely special guest, and nothing is too much trouble. Our spacious Courtyard Suite was fabulously appointed mixing tradition with subtle I-Pad controls. It was lovely to receive hand-written notes from staff to wish us a pleasant stay and also with a delightful gift and birthday cake on 25th August. The gardens are exotic and provide a perfect back drop to al fresco breakfast .. we were transported to a past age when enjoying the traditional

title: Everything you imagined it would be
desc: Raffles is everything you ever imagined it would be. The hotel precinct is over a city block and every space is carefully considered. I cannot wait to stay again. As expected, the service is exceptional (perhaps except for Long Bar) and the staff are so friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much for them. The room we had was beyond incredible. We had a separate lounge area, a beautiful bedroom suite which closed off from the lounge and lovely outdoor seating on the veranda overlooking the courtyard garden. The timber, furnishings and finishes in the room are so beautiful. Dining for dinner at Tiffin was outstanding. Honestly the best Indian food I’ve ever had. The afternoon tea (a must do) was lovely and breakfast in the restaurant was SO good. Always perfect service and

title: Fabulous Celebration
desc: Silver wedding anniversary and first return in 25 years. Experience amazing and staff were extremely friendly, attentive, helpful and polite. Our Palm Court suite was beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable. We can't recommend Raffles highly enough.

title: Raffles great experience
desc: Raffles hotel Singapore is a must do experience. Large room and outstanding customer service. Afternoon tea was delicious. Cocktails in the writers bar was outstanding. Dinner and breakfast in the main lobby restaurant was superb. The location and ambiance of the hotel was amazing. Drinks and a swim at the pool was lovely. Check in and out was easy. However, my best memories will be about the customer service, attentive but not invasive. Thanks Raffles for an experience of a lifetime.

title: Holiday
desc: Best ever hotel stay Singapore Sling,monkey nuts Meet Ria at the long bar he is the best Allen was amazing took care and great tips from him Rachel was great Sukhdev uncle still missing him Overall the best

title: Very comfortable stay
desc: I was holding a wedding at the Raffles Hotel, so my room type was upgraded, and the whole room was larger. Although the hotel is in the city, it is very quiet, I can't hear the sound outside at all, and all the controls in the room can be passed through An iPad is used to control it, which is very convenient. We also have our own personal butler. If there is any problem, the butler will reply and solve it quickly. At the end of the check-out procedure, we only need to make a phone call from the room. I would like to especially thank Wendy Ho (Senior Events Manager, Raffles Hotel Singapore), she is a very conscientious and responsible manager who can advise and arrange for the needs of the guests. My wedding involved many aspects, and she assisted us a lot so that we were well

title: Best hotel stay ever.
desc: The best hotel I have ever stayed at. From start to finish their attention to detail was extremely good, the atmosphere created throughout the hotel was very warm and inviting. The staff were attentive and friendly and very committed to ensuring you had the best service.

title: Amazing customer service
desc: Is The Raffles the best hotel in the world? We certainly think so after an unexpected visit there today. Just a quick nostalgic peek - haven’t been there for 40 years. We cheekily asked to have a picture with the doorman as we don’t have any pictures from way back. Sukkhdev immediately agreed and Allen took the picture. Then Allen called a taxi for us and we chatted about our memories of Singapore until Sukkhdev saw us into the taxi. This will stay in our memories for a long time - well done for such amazing customer service. Hope to be back soon. Garry & Barbara

title: Bucket List Stay
desc: What an amazing bucket list experience. Raffles have done the most magnificent upgrade of this Grand Dame, with a modern touch without loosing the history and ambiance of this 100+ year old Hotel. if you want to spoil yourself, stay here for a night or 2. Must do is the Afternoon Tea, beautiful selection of food, lovely teas and a glass of bubbles to toast anything you want.

title: Service beyond compare
desc: The moment we arrived, we were made to feel special, almost as part of the Raffles Family! Overwhelmed by the beautiful bouquet of roses and hearts made out of flowers on the table with a cute Happy Honeymoon dessert ! I cried when I saw we both had beautifully wrapped silky pjs! What an amazing experience, we will be back!

title: Really friendly atmosphere
desc: A fantastic place to visit, stunning looking hotel. Myself, my wife and my Three boys went one evening at 9.30pm to sample the legendary Singapore Sling and wasn't disappointed. We were met by the most friendliest concierge I have ever met, Harpreet made us welcome and pointed us in the right direction to the long bar. Short wait of around 15 minutes for a table but worth it. Great atmosphere and staff. Well worth a visit its great. Even if you go and just meet Harpreet.

title: Raffles
desc: Stopped in for a Singapore sling at the long bar, something you just have to do. The building is beautiful and interesting history provided j to the hotel and the drink. Harpreet on the door couldn’t be more polite and helpful!

title: Tour of Hotel to celebrate our 25th Wedding anniversary
desc: I would like to send our heartfelt thanks to Raffles Hotel and in particular, Mr Roslee Bin Sukar, the hotel's historian for making our visit so enjoyable and memorable. My wife and I were returning to the hotel for the first time since spending our honeymoon there 25 years ago but this time with our three children. Mr Sukar gave us a personalised tour of the hotel, even showing our children the hotel suite we had previously stayed in. Mr Sukar's knowledge and passion for Raffles was both impressive and infectious and the whole of our family were very impressed.

title: Excellent Stay with Awesome Service
desc: Had stayed for 3D2N and was arranged in the Palm Court Suite. The spacious room was clean and amenities were all well prepared. The butlers and front desk staff were all amazing and friendly. The team even took special notice to our celebration and had prepared a couple of surprise amenities for us that made our day. Thank you to Grace, Jiyeon, Shuxian, Jeremy, Ancy and Elena for making us feel welcome and doing a wonderful job in taking care of us during our stay. Would definitely love to stay again if ever the chance.

title: Mooncake Worst customer experience for loyal customer
desc: Ordered double egg yolk mooncake, purposely went all the way to collect early but they ran out of stock! Very bad customer experience. Waste customer’s precious time. Very loyal customer but will never order their mooncake ever again

title: Pure luxury
desc: Fabulous from check in to check out. The hotel is exquisite, pure luxury. We had 2 suites and both were beautifully decorated with every little thing thought about. Our butler (Andrew) was so helpful with assisting us with bookings for Tiffins and afternoon tea - both of which were booked up but the hotel managed to fit us in. Breakfast was excellent - a lovely setting and very wide selection. Service from everyone we came into contact with was outstanding. We will definitely stay in other Raffles hotels when travelling - we have been spoilt by our Raffles experience and our expectations of service has been taken to a whole new level!

title: A Lefendary Stay at the Grand Old Dame
desc: This was a superlative stay. The rooms were updated and luxuriously furnished, with iPad controls for everything in the suite. The bathroom wa stunning, and being able to soak in the long bath was such a treat. We booked the stay to celebrate my mum's birthday, and the staff made it truly memorable. The front desk coordinated with the Tiffin Room to surprise us with a birthday pancake during breakfast on the day of the birthday, and the butlers, Wei Ying and Sunny were incredibly thoughtful, and gifted the birthday dame with curated gifts which touched us deeply. My parents also loved the tour of the hotel by Roslee, who was so knowlegeable and passionate he made a nearly 2 hour history tour pass in moments. I strongly recommend this tour, which gave significance to many

title: A nice one off experience.
desc: We were collected from the airport and received a seamless check in to our upgraded suite. The welcome was lovely and attentive. The afternoon tea was excellent and the service and experience in the Writers Bar was first class. While tasty, the breakfast portions were small and the cost was overpriced. While we enjoyed the stay, the checkout process was cumbersome and confusing due to changes to make it contactless - it slowed the process down. The stay was a nice one off experience but it was rather overpriced in comparison to similar levels of hotels we have visited.

title: Absolutely amazing
desc: I submitted my glowing review directly on the Raffles Hotel website: check it out! In a nutshell, though I have been a traveler for a long time, have tried hotels good and bad in many places, and am not easily impressed (yet not blasé either), this one is at the very top of my list!!!

title: is this the best hotel in the world?
desc: This hotel is wonderful and i cannot recommend it enough. it does everything it says on the can!!! The room was excellent and the staff fantastic, nothing was too much trouble, the long bar manager and the concierge desk was exceptional, as were everyone else I wish I could remember their names. a tranquil location in a very busy city. i really hope i will return one day

title: Luxury stay reminds you of Colonial times
desc: A dream to stay at this iconic landmark in Singapore for a staycation that transports you back to Colonial times. The room was spacious and luxurious (we stayed in the Elizabeth Taylor), staff is responsive and gracious, and you feel transported back in history. My negative feedback is for the food quality we experienced in the Courtyard and breakfast in the Tiffin Room. It's stuck in the early 2000's at best and offers very little variety to vegetarians and vegans. Who serves ice cold quiche at breakfast? The Long Bar was wonderful!

title: Everything was EXCEPTIONAL
desc: The staff, the food, the room, the pool, the experience - everything was exceptional. We escaped for the F1 and Raffles was perfectly positioned to get to wherever we needed to watch the event. Nothing was ever too much trouble and you felt at home.

title: The hotel that all others aspire to be
desc: The most iconic hotel. The hotel that all other hotels aspire to be and when you do go and stay you can understand why. You can feel the history from Long Bar to the famous pictures on the walls. If you are able to go and experience this magnificent place, then do so.

title: Sensational Stay
desc: What an amazing place. The room was fantastic, as was the food and service. We had massages in the day spa and it was also fabulous. The concierge helped us organise an amazing evening with great advice on the gardens, dining options and bars.

title: Afternoon tea in the Grand Lobby
desc: On our last day in Singapore we splurged on afternoon tea at the famous Raffles Hotel & thoroughly enjoyed it. The food was delicious and there was plenty of it, the tea was topped up frequently and the surroundings were a delight. Service was very attentive and the music provided by a harpist was exactly the thing - a lovely background accompaniment to a very special experience. Champagne is extra and a bit pricey at $25 a glass, so I stopped at one. This was a once in a lifetime experience and it did not disappoint.

title: Amazing experience
desc: We had a wonderful 7 night stay at Raffles Singapore that was pure heaven. The staff at Raffles are exceptional and made us feel like we were part of the family. They went out of their way to assist us with anything we needed. The staff made us feel extremely welcome and they made our visit 10 out of 10. The hotel is so beautiful and the staff keep it spotless, we were amazed the care taken to keep the hotel to the standard you would expect. I cannot fault anything for our 7 night stay. We will be back.

title: Wonderful
desc: Wonderful experience with great privacy, some hiccups food wise but everything else was awesome and no regrets booking. It is a luxury hotel with luxury prices no doubt, but the quality matches the price.

title: Iconic slumber place
desc: Singapore's most iconic slumber place is worth a quick visit while visiting the city. The lush tropical grounds and famous white ivory facades were breathtaking. Went for proper tea and loved being pampered with yummy finger foods and experience the art of civility.

title: Classic Beauty and Style
desc: From our arrival to delayed departure for a late flight the staff and services at Raffles was exceptional. No action was too much trouble, and we were made to feel very important to the staff who seemed centered on ensuring we were comfortable and satisfied with our stay. Each staff member felt like an old friend and this enabled us to feel at home. Russell was exceptional on arrival with Allen taking care of us for our late departure from the hotel.

title: Amazing service from Grab and Go Team
desc: Bell from the grab and go team has been amazing! and her service is excellent, she went above and beyond to assist with my requests, and to ensure my request and expectations met by having prompt communication and updates. We are very very happy with the food and service from the team! Thank you once again for your great service, and of course kudos to the chefs who made our request happen without any hiccups.

title: You have to stay here when in Singapore
desc: Perfect from start to finish will return next time we are in Singapore the room was super and the staff were fantastic very attentive and helpful. Breakfast was perfect and it was good to experience the Singapore sling in the long bar … overall well recommend

title: Magical stay at Raffles. Absolute Legendary Service, Sublime ambience, Charm and Heritage. Best of the Best!
desc: From our arrival with the outstanding honor guard and door team, to checking in with the concierge we felt like we had entered a dream of days gone by juxtaposed with a modern day utopia. Walking around such a magnificent property where every turn delights the senses and every team member enhances your experience was truly unbelievable. We loved our room, the old world charm mixed with the cutting edge technology. Everything about the room, bedding, bathroom and room furnishings was perfect! Every dining experience was sublime. We felt like Royalty, from Hotel Manager Patrick Fisher to the team with inspired hospitality and service Selvam Gnana, Bernie, Joseph Lim, Leslie Danker, Son Jiyeon, Allina, Serina, Mindy, Alfani, Joshua, Jason, Suresh, Bernard, Kan, Allen, Narayan,

title: True luxury
desc: We celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary at the hotel. It was a great true luxury experience. The hotel is magnificent and it has been renewed tastefully blending a majestic colonial setting with the latest technology. EVERYTHING we did felt top notch. It feels real when the ingredients (suite, food, facilities, decoration, etc.) and the mindset (everyone in the staff makes you feel welcome and pampered) are aligned. This is not easy to accomplish. Bravo Raffles!

title: Only one grand dame!
desc: The experience for my three nights at this location was exemplary and I will forever remember the service, dining options, my suite and the staff. For me this was a "bucket list location" that was worth the investment. I will definitely be returning in the future for another special stay.

title: Worth the effort!
desc: If you're in Singapore and thinking (as I did) should I bother with Raffles, there's so much else to do, I'll just say you'll be glad you did, even just for a trip to the Long Bar for a Singapore Sling. And don't think oh that's so touristy, because they only offer 4 drinks on the menu during the day time, as they pretty much want you to order the sling. And you should, it's fantastic! You don't need to dress up either, during the day anyway, normal street wear is fine, although some people did make the effort as well. Kids are also welcome. Staff are super friendly, and don't rush you, but I would recommend getting there near opening time (12pm) as it gets busy fast and a queue forms outside. And yes, it is expected for you to throw the peanut shells on the floor! It takes

title: Majestic to the superlative degree
desc: Words cannot fully explain our appreciation for the beautiful memories we now have of our stay there as part of our 40th wedding anniversary celebration. We are not well-to-do people, yet from the initial online booking through to the final goodbye, we were treated by every single person there as though we were royalty. The attention given to every detail including being called residents not guests, so many remembering and acknowledging it was our anniversary, ensuring the personal touch was always graciously shown, the enjoyment of sharing humor and a laugh, to mention just a few examples to explain our experience. The location in Singapore, each type of room offered, and the amenities provided tick all the boxes. Even though there are now more hotels around the world under

title: Lovely Bar great atmosphere
desc: We went to the long bar in Raffles hotel, it’s been a long time since we have brb been here. We both remember sitting out on the grass at the front of the hotel. Now the bar is upstairs. It is still lovely and the cocktails are as amazing as ever. You can’t visit Singapore without having a Gin Sling at Raffles 😁 Special thanks to Tom for trying to make our special cocktail. It was lovely.

title: The most beautiful hotel in Singapore
desc: I love the history of Raffles, after the restoration, the colonial style , good old charm has been well retained. I particularly love the grand lobby of Raffles, it was a good experience to have a Traditional Raffles afternoon tea there. The only one thing which I don’t like is the lighting of bedroom, it’s kind of dark even in the day time. The rest part of hotel are stunning.

title: Home of the original Singapore Sling
desc: You can’t visit Singapore without visiting Raffles Hotel and having a Singapore Sling. Raffles Hotel is a colonial-style hotel steeped in history. It was built in 1887. The hotel was named after British statesman Sir Thomas Stamford Raffles, the founder of modern Singapore. The original Singapore Sling is available along with some of the variations that have been created over the years. I had the 1915 variety whilst taking in the ambiance of this lovely bar, eating monkey nuts and throwing the shells on the floor. I would certainly recommend a visit.

title: Outstanding experience
desc: A beautifully renovated hotel maintaining the period features but incorporating every desirable modern upgrade. The staff were always helpful and extremely courteous, the restaurants are of excellent quality and the rooms extremely comfortable.

title: Expensive but worthwhile doing
desc: Raffles Singapore was a beautiful place, we had the high tea and whilst expensive was something you do once. We ordered champagne but could not order a cocktail across the 1.5 hours here, and had to head to the long room for a Singapore sling. There is always a wait but was not too long and once inside, it is worth the wait! Very friendly bartenders and while also expensive, a once off experience. Just be prepared for the $38 Singapore Sling!

title: A world of elegance and charm.
desc: I cannot overstate how much we enjoyed our few days at The Raffles; from the warmth of our welcome, the excellence of our suite, the polite friendliness of the service, I could not fault a thing, nor find any areas for improvement. Being greeted by name on our return from a day out made us feel very welcome and valued. The food in the restaurants we tried was unfailingly delicious and elegantly served. Every member of staff we encountered was polite and helpful without ever being obsequious. Raffles really gets it right in every area, thank you all for a wonderful stay!

title: The best
desc: Staying at Raffles was amazing. We felt well looked after, pampered, and comfortable to an unimaginable degree. The staff are all extremely polite and friendly, and the rooms were spacious, comfortable, and a real joy to spend time in. One negative comment regards the bed: not very comfortable, which was really surprising. The bedding is amazing, but there is no mattress topper, to make it softer and more inviting. All hotels have that these days and it makes all the difference.

title: Grande Dame
desc: Reeks of history - fully restored, perhaps a little too renovated - apart from the odd piece of antique furniture and some black and white photos it seems a little sterile Excellent staff- nice breakfast We stayed in a suite - could do with some more lighting - dark room

title: Grande Dame
desc: Great old hotel totally renovated - perhaps too much as there is a sterile feel about it Could do with more antique furniture from the period Great staff. Rooms a bit dark Good breakfast Bar is excellent, though prices a fraction high

title: Afternoon Tea
desc: The hotel and reception are just stunning but the afternoon tea was pretty disappointing to be honest. Four tiny sandwiches, two plates of cakes and warm scones served on arrival so we're cold by the time we'd eaten our sandwiches. And it's so expensive. They are other options for afternoon tea with more variety and better value. It's lovely but hard to justify the cost with the product.

title: Very swanky
desc: This might just be one of the swankiest hotels in Singapore. It's been made famous because of the famous Singapore Sling cocktail. Great place to have afternoon tea and hotel residents have their very own entrance!

title: Incredible Tour of The Raffles Hotel History
desc: The hotel and dining is absolutely outstanding, however, you must experience a guided tour of the iconic Raffles Hotel from Mr Roslee. It is fascinating, and I must say that Mr Roslee is truly one of the many treasures of Singapore. His story-telling, his history, his customer care is truly amazing. If in Singapore, taking one of Mr Roslee's guided tours is a "must do"!

title: Absolute Luxury.
desc: Amazing. We chose Raffles for our twenty year wedding anniversary and it was better than we could have hoped for. Quite simply the best accommodation we have stayed in. Right from the check in experience nothing was ever a problem and the attention to detail was simply superb. The room and amenities were magnificent and the meal at the Butchers Block restaurant for our anniversary evening was beautiful. We will definitely stay again..

title: Classic hotel
desc: Classic hotel. I felt like I was walking back in time. Good service and great breakfast. Many good restaurant outlets as well. Spacious with some good high end shoppings. I like the garden. Bell men are very polite and helpful. I like the lively Long Bar

title: Amazing Birthday Stay
desc: Staycay together with my mum and it was a birthday treat to her. Exceptional excellent service especially to Belinda who’s midst of internship, greeted and showed us to the suite upon arrival and Gibson who attended to us at last night (15 Oct Saturday) dinner and this morning (Sunday 16 Oct breakfast). Also to the team of butlers too.

title: The most spectacular Hotel on earth
desc: We planned this most special visit on our last day in Singapore... Having booked in advance for a heritage dinner with champagne on the Grand Lobby we got there over an hour early so we could walk aroind the hotel and give us time to get into the long bar where the Singapore Sling was created.... and woe..oh wow... the greeting was spectacular by tue Sheike doorman, the stagg coukdnt be moe friendly and were more than happy to have photos..or take photos for us. The long bar was just brilliant, where the likes of Ryyard Kipling sat for hours.... and the Grand Lobby is just the most stunning venue for an excusite culenary experinece with world class service... it is something very very special and worth every single penny..

title: A Memorable Experience
desc: Stayed three nights on a layover from Australia to the USA, but Raffles would have been worth the whole trip itself. The property is immaculately maintained and is well situated in the heart of the city. Rooms are spacious and every request is taken care of by the room's butler service. Breakfasts and afternoon tea were perfect. Staff are courteous, super helpful and kind and never questioned a request. Roslee's historic tour of the property is certainly a must for anyone interested in the history of this iconic hotel.

title: Beautiful hotel steeped in history - be sure to check out the great little boutiques around the sides of the hotel too
desc: Every time we visit Singapore we always visit raffles for our Singapore Sling that just has to be consumed We arrived to the hotel on a Thursday around 12.30 -1.pm and walked straight in. The later you arrive, the bigger the queue Ordered my drinks and the arrived very quickly and again didn’t disappoint (the fastest $100 on drinks we have ever spent) but for me worth the experience The hotel is stunning and so clean. Nothing is an issue and everyone is so pleasant.

title: Raffles 🇸🇬 review
desc: When we were last in Singapore 31 years ago. Raffles was closed for refurbishment. So it was a must visit this time around. Very expensive, but it’s got to be done. Never had a Singapore 🇸🇬 Sling before. It went well with the monkey 🥜 nuts. The hotel is fantastic building just to wander about and get a feel for the history it oozes.

title: Its downhill from now
desc: Everything was immaculate, from the reception we received on arrival to the condition of the hotel and the quality of the room. I doubt I will ever stay in such a high-quality hotel that is at at the top of its game as this was. Newly renovated, motivated staff. Brilliant

title: Stayed there, Done that. A Luxury nite stay @ Raffles Hotel
desc: Stay there, done that. Staying is believing. 2D1N, October, F1 weekend. Quieter than I expected. I can roamed around taking pictures like an ‘influencer’. Did some homework on where to take n how to pose. Stay wise - 5 star Tranquility is the word . Satified with the good night sleep.I had not been sleeping well for the past few months and the precious 1 nite rest is so worth it. Food wise - 2 star Least expectation. Mayb bcos I am local and I know the taste of certain food. Was quite disappointed with the Nasi Lemak. My home-cooked NL is way way better.

title: Unsurpassable
desc: The best hotel you can imagine. Cannot fault anything. Friendly staff, great service, excellent room, superb location and the breakfast is to die for. Meticulously maintained and recently carefully renovated to the smallest detail. Would definitely stay again.

title: Exceptional Service in a most pristine Property - Flawless
desc: Super comfortable rooms, with fluffy soft quality linen ( another level of comfort) . Staff well groomed, courteous, and anticipate needs . Very refreshing nowadays. High Tea a must do. Love the classical music. Long Bar for the famous Singapore Sling is a must. Wonderful to get fast track into the bar being a resident ( long lines) . Well done to the management and staff for maintaining such standards in a huge operation, and making it look so easy to guests. Attention to detail, is remarkable.

title: Disappointeds with afternoon tea, maybe expectations a bit high.
desc: On previous two visits to Singapore we have had afternoon tea at Raffles as a special to ourselves. So after 5 weeks of visiting relations in the UK we decided to spoil ourselves again. The staff were very welcoming, and efficient without being overbearing. What was disappointing was the amount of food and that you had to pay extra for a drink. At 80+ dollars a head its a bit steep. There was minimal hot food - two scones each-. Where were the sausage rolls, small pies, samosa etc? The sandwiches and cakes were nice but didn't really satisfy our hunger. As a comparison the Hyatt in Canberra does a great afternoon high tea and it would be good for the F & B Mamager to visit and see what they do for a lesser price. But we did enjoy ourselves and thank you to the staff and harpist

title: An amazing resort experience in the middle of the city.
desc: Everything from the amazing restoration to the impeccable service and attention to detail was on another level. The food and beverage offer is so well curated and offers great variety and choice. We woke up to a stunning breakfast at Tiffin, relaxed by the pool and enjoyed a delicious tuna takaki salad and for dinner we were mesmerised by the innovation and wine pairing at Butcher's Block. Finally a night cap at the infamous Long Bar before retiring to the elegance and understated charm of our suite. What more can I say!! An experience not to be missed. GP

title: Amazing hotel experience
desc: The quality of the hotel and the service was second to none. Nothing was too difficult for the staff and they made my wife and I feel very special. We spent most of our time in Singapore inside the hotel exploring and enjoying

title: No alcohol free drinks ??????
desc: My wife and I went to the raffles hotel for an afternoon drinks only to be told that they did not have any alcohol free cocktails, I asked for a juice or a sprite only to be told sorry we do not have any alcohol free drinks when I asked about tea or coffee even the replay back was “ sorry sir as I have already told you we do Not have any alcohol free drinks at the moment” which I did not believe when I asked to speak to a manager I was told “they were all Busy”. Shame as we had really looked forward to going and enjoying the experience 🤔🤔😢😢

title: Great location for shopping, sightseeing and dining.
desc: Raffles reputation is well known and rightly so not only does it live up to its reputation but, as far as I am concerned, exceeds it. The staff are outstanding and their attention to detail is exemplary, they remember your preferences for everything you eat and drink and they call you by your name, always. It appears that you are not a guest, you are their guest and will and do make your stay memorable.

title: AFTERNOON TEA
desc: The Afternoon Tea at Raffles Hotel Singapore is pleasant. We had comfortable sofa and chair seating in the Grand Lobby location that was surprisingly quiet and the accompanying music by a harpist was enjoyable. But as a lover of afternoon tea this experience could be improved. There is a very limited selection of teas to choose from and Raffles uses tea bags not leaves! And for the size of pot there should have been 2 tea bags but there was only one. My Earl Grey tea was weak and tasteless and the addition of a second tea bag didn’t improve this. The sandwiches, cakes and scones were all delicious but like the use of a single tea bag, the portions were tiny. Given the cost of this afternoon tea I was expecting more - larger portion sizes or the option for more sandwiches, extra

title: Thank you Allen
desc: My husband is in a wheelchair so its always a bit awkward trying to find the disabled access but as we were standing on the pavement a kind concierge Allen came over and first of all took a lovely photo of us then walked with us all the way into the hotel while telling us the history of Raffles. It was as beautiful as we were told it would be and Allen made the whole experience even better, many thanks.

title: Its just WOW
desc: A great property, excellent staff and its amazing. Accor got it right and for me the best hotel in world. Excellent food and great service. Highly recommend to dine at Tiffin Room and Ann Sophie. A great place and I will be back.

title: Long-bar long sling
desc: Great venue, friendly staff and awesome historic venue. Doormen are more than happy to be photographed. Long bar is a must for a Singapore sling ($32) Visitors are friendly and always up for a chat . Not stuffy and pretentious as you might think. You can access some of the grounds and walk around if you want, some areas are guest only!

title: Afternoon Tea
desc: Very disappointing. This was the second time we had booked afternoon tea. The first time we were served in The Tiffin Room and the tea consisted of delicate sandwiches, scones, other interesting sweet items and hot asian food. We enjoyed the visit so much that we booked again. This time we were sat in what felt like the lobby as guests walked through with luggage and shopping. Staff were impersonal. The food was mediocre and expensive for what was served, four finger sandwiches, several sweet items and scones which had been warm when the cake stand was brought to the table but by the time one was ready to eat them, after the sandwiches, were cold. Will not be returning for a third time. I would not recommend afternoon tea in it's presnt form.

title: Afternoon Tea disappointing
desc: Can’t believe how poor the afternoon tea was on Tuesday the 29th November 2022. To start with we were asked to dress casually but smart which we always do, to arrive seeing people walk around in trainers, shorts and T-shirts. This made the whole place feel cheap and more like a tourist attraction then a classy hotel which has history. Once we sat down we were presented with 5 finger sandwiches each. When we asked for more they asked which ones we like the most and just bought 2 more fingers sandwiches out each. The little cakes were nice but the scones were tiny and felt like they had been factory made not home made. We got given one small dish of jam and whipped cream to share. We asked for one each which they had sitting on the tray when serving, I think they were hoping we

title: Outstanding experience by great staff. Definitely try the famous Singapore sling.
desc: We visited the courtyard for food and of course the Singapore sling. Yes it’s expensive but it’s Raffles !! The staff are amazing and so welcoming. Front desk guy, fully dressed in Indian attire made for amazing keepsake photographs and he even gave us free water bottles with the logo whilst we waited for our taxi. We could not fault this amazing experience. The hotel is just beautiful and the perfect backdrop for some great holiday snaps.

title: Average Afternoon Tea
desc: Afternoon tea. Nothing special. Too much chocolate. No cucumber sandwiches. Good quality, but overpriced. Thought it would be something special, yet it was average. Only average. Thought as it was Raffles that it would be something worth paying top dollar, yet left disappointed.

title: Room 228
desc: Raffles sells itself, it oozes opulence as you are pulling up, we had 4 nights here and didn’t want to leave the hotel, everything about it is amazing The one thing that I wasn’t to highlight is the staff, from the moment you are picked up from the airport it feels like every member of staff is there just for you, it’s seamless check in to seamless check out and the in between is made so comfortable you never want to leave, Mathis checked us in, showed us around, very professional and the butlers are amazing, we hardly used them but when needed they were there for you, we asked if they had some bubble bath, when we got back to the room the bath was already filled and ready to go, the concierge were great especially the one with glasses, I missed his name But two people I

title: Amazing
desc: Raffles Singapore produced an experience that can rarely be had. The staff were, without exception, wonderful, with a level of hospitality and professionalism that are unmatched. The venue, beautiful, extremely well maintained, faultless, and immaculately clean.

title: Wow!!!!
desc: I felt like royalty staying here to be honest. The greeting, the accommodations. Butler service was perfect. Room was more than a room and was huge as well as comfortable. Was here as part of a long birthday celebration and they made sure i enjoyed my stay. Beautiful grounds. Would definitely come back for another stay.

title: The best :)
desc: We stayed 1 night to celebrate our birthday and TEAM Raffles made our day :) Aldina checked us in upon arrival and Huiqin assisted us with check out, both super helpful and very smooth. All our inquiries were answered well and very friendly. Butler Thyra and Neesha were amazing butlers. It was the best staycation ever and they created unforgettable memories for our birthday! Thanks all, really appreciated :)

title: Thanks Harpreet
desc: We are always delighted to go to the Raffles Hotels and enjoy the warm welcome from Harpreet. He is an excellent asset to Raffles. We look forward to seeing him & Raffles again soon. BBR is a fantastic Italian restaurant. The pizza and deserts.

title: Classy Afternoon tea and Awesome staff
desc: Visited Raffles hotel recently for a luxury afternoon tea and it was amazing 🤩 We were attended by this young man Gibson and his service was impeccable. We love the way he greeted us and the whole experience was just so magical. Food was ok, we both like the sandwiches and the scones with the rose jam. Sligtly expensive but VERY recommended.

title: Out of this world experience!
desc: Everything about the hotel was spectacularly well chosen, groomed, and made to feel like an oasis. From being picked up by the driver in the arrivals hall, to being greeted by the doorman and butler, I felt taken care of and relaxed. The service is top notch, from the well kept rooms and buildings, to the small details the staff offer you and deliver on. My butler was excellent at recommending me late opening restaurants for my dinner when I arrived later than expected, and took care of my needs including setting up the bath, and helping me sort out currency. Raffles definitely aims to pre-empt your needs, and it is spectacular! As a small side effect, sometimes they could do with a small ask. For instance, the welcome chocolates I received were so delicious, I was saving them

title: Wonderful Afternoon Tea
desc: This was my first time visiting Raffles Singapore . The hotel is beautifully decorated , staff very polite & professional & the Afternoon Tea was of an excellent standard. The harp player added a nice relaxed atmosphere. I highly recommend this lovely venue & Afternoon Tea .

title: Family trip
desc: Amazing everything! Room, service, food, location. Organized a fabulous tour guide and driver! Wonderful stay with 3 generations of my family! Classic hotel with a lot of interesting history, very well renovated. Would recommend for anyone traveling to Singapore.

title: Chris
desc: Location was great, close to all amenities. Most amazing hotel ever, excellent staff and facilities and couldn’t make you more welcome if they tried!! Food on site was lovely but local restaurants nearby also good and great atmosphere

title: Extremely disappointed
desc: Having long been looking forward to High Tea in the hotel Lobby we arrived promptly at 15.00 and were seated soon after. We were having the standard afternoon tea. One with Ceylon black tea and I was having the house ground coffee. After 30 mins a tea pot for 2 arrived plus one coffee. This was fine until we found that only 1 tea bag had been used for the 2 person pot. We also pointed out that no milk had been provided. 2 teabags were in the 2nd teapot when it arrived but still no milk And by the way no tiered tray of sandwiches had arrived either. A waiter did try to serve scones jam and clotted cream but we pointed out that we would prefer them after sandwiches etc My partner got very upset having expected a fabulous experience for the event that she had looked forward to

title: Amazing experience
desc: Beautiful hotel with amazing staff. Very attentive to your every need, will go all out to ensure your needs are met. Clean, fresh and very welcoming. Food was divine. Grounds are well kept. Look forward to going back.

title: Fabulous
desc: Visited the long bar for famous Singapore sling and it didn’t disappoint just as I thought it would be Great atmosphere great polite and helpful service and amazing drink It was on my bucket list of things to do so box ticked It’s a real must if you go to Singapore We only waited about 15 mins for a table some said a hour but we had no problem

title: Just wow. What an amazing experience.
desc: We stayed on Raffles for a special birthday and what an experience. The Staff were exceptional as you would expect. It’s a real oasis in a bustling city. Rooms are perfect with the most comfortable beds and every mod con you could wish for all hidden in the beautiful colonial decor. Definitely one for the bucket list

title: Felt too corporate
desc: The good: Rooms and all public areas were excellently appointed - all furnishings were cared for to an impeccable standard. The pool is an oasis of calm and the team who work there were super friendly. A cocktail or coffee on the roof after breakfast is a must. The front of house service team were, on the whole, friendly and welcoming- as were the butlers, door men and check-in team. Breakfast was plentiful - there is much to choose from as the hotel caters for all tastes. The service went to pieces on one of the days - such a shame - lots of tutting and shaking of heads from patrons which we can only assume was why the manager turned up to support. The not so good: Overall Raffles lacks character and personality - it is a place we wish we’d visited perhaps 20 or 30 years

title: Comfortable, Relaxing stay
desc: Beautifully decorated and clean rooms. Helpful staff. Excellent breakfast buffet. Grounds are an oasis within the city. The butler service provider is a nice personal touch - ours came through for us in a pinch with a last minute laundry request. Honestly couldn't ask for more from a hotel experience!

title: class apart
desc: the butlers are a class apart 👍👌 they are very efficient , extremely friendly, forever smiling, and ever so ready to go an extra mile to make the stay comfortable hospitality at its best the doormen, lobby attendants, front desk staff are highly professional, smiling, helpful, and asking frequently if anything was required 👍 our dinner at the “tiffin room”, a part of Raffles’ since 1892, was deliciously tasty 😋😋 everyone attending our table was wonderfully hospitable, especially the short haired lady taking our orders, attending to our needs, and visiting our table (and others) every couple of minutes … very hard working team … the sommelier too, was well informed on wines and exceedingly helpful the courtyard bar @ “Raffles Courtyard” has bartenders who are

title: Tea time!
desc: Went for their afternoon tea. It was exceptional. Great service, nice options, refills for sandwiches and scones. Hotel grounds are beautiful. Welcome at the hotel door was very warm. Absolutely unique interior. All in all, very special and tea time sold me on staying at the Raffles during the next visit to Singapore (in one of their renovated rooms).

title: Luxury. Personal Service. Problem Solving.
desc: We had a few problems with our original room (Telephones not working and power issues) and were on the verge of leaving the hotel, but for us the measure of a hotel in this situation is how they handle it. We don't expect anything free, but we want things resolved. Raffles resolved the issues and turned our stay around. They were lovely and patient and helpful and caring. They spent a lot of time making the whole stay perfect and for that we will always stay here in Singapore from now on. It is the kind of service that makes a truly spectacular hotel experience memorable- for what is life without shared multi-layered memories. The hotel itself is a luxury retreat and it is very accessible to all of Singapore's sights - particularly if you know your way around the subterranean/

title: Legendary service
desc: We stayed in a personality suite which we found clean, comfortable and spacious. The single panel (via in room iPads) for room controls (tv, blinds and lights), butler service and in room dining was convenient. Service was always friendly and professional and with an attention to detail. The hotel is centrally located and it’s beautiful garden surrounds provides an oasis from the hustle and bustle of the city. The low rise, courtyard layout provides a personalised boutique feel for guests. There is absolutely nothing to fault - impeccable service from all and nicely refurbished suites. An iconic hotel with a well deserved reputation for service. We highly recommend a stay at Raffles Hotel if you are looking for luxury and enjoy the finer things in life.

title: Impeccable Service
desc: My wife and I had a wonderful Christmas at Raffles Hotel, Singapore. The staff went above and beyond to ensure all our needs were met. We also received Christmas gifts which were a lovely surprise. Our suite was immaculate. When our room safe failed to operate a phone call resulted in our butler arriving within minutes with a technician who quickly resolved the issue. When my wife needed a difficult prescription filling on a public holiday the concierge took over and scoured local pharmacies over a 2 hour period to get what she needed without us needing to leave the room. The food was delightful. The recent refurbishment to the hotel has been done very tastefully retaining the character and charm of the hotel. The in-suite automation (using tablet computers) controlling the

title: An Old British Oasis In a Very Modern City
desc: This is a bit of old British luxury in the heart of a bustling modern city. Staff, food, accommodations and service were excellent and everyone worked so hard to receive that rating -- so it is a shame that the owner of Raffles, the Accor hotel group, badly marred our experience with a terrible fumble at the outset. Upon check-in, we were notified that our reservation had been canceled by Accor's computer system. According to Raffles staff, the computer system just arbitrarily and on its own made the decision to cancel us -- which evoked images of HAL in 2001: A Space Odyssey saying in response to our desire to check in: "I'm sorry Dave, but I cannot do that." While staff gave us a "gee, I'm sorry about that" apology, we were nonetheless justifiably irritated by the

title: The literal definition of world class
desc: I can't say enough about Raffles Singapore. There are hotels out there that showcase that not all 5 star hotels are considered equal, this is one of them. Everything from the absolutely gorgeous rooms, the bespoke mini bar, the grounds, the incredible staff, check-in, all of it, is top rate and simply a level, or multiple levels, above any other property in Singapore. Usually I write longer reviews and go through different elements of the property. Here I feel like there is no need. I'll make a special call out for the service which was exemplary, practically everywhere and on all accounts. If you're considering a stay at the Raffles don't hesitate, do it. There is no better place to stay in Singapore and it is one of the greatest city properties in the world, bar none.

title: Total disgust and disappointment
desc: We visited Raffles on Christmas Eve 2022. We were booked in the Courtyard for 8.30pm. On arrival we were directed to our table. We were in a party of 4 ‘we ordered a total of 8 Singapore Slings, then a serving of 3 Sliders For each person . They arrived around 8.45pm every one of the Sliders were identical. A tiny Slider with a minute burger, they were dry And we did not eat the majority of them . We felt totally ripped off with a bill of $500.00 + We were continually advised that we must hurry As they were due to close. We were told on at least 3 occasions to eat and drink up . Why on earth do you take bookings for Christmas Eve then tell people hurry up that your closing . The food service and cost was a total disgrace For a Hotel of Raffles standard . Shame on you .

title: Incredible Experience at top notch luxury hotel
desc: What an incredible property! We stayed at the Raffles for 2 days during this Winter Holiday and could have stayed longer. We had a courtyard suite that really took us back in time and made us feel like we were taken back to colonial Singapore, with a porch out to the lovely gardens, incredible luxury amenities, and comfort beyond belief. The charm of this hotel cannot be understated! The service was exceptional - of course you must have a Singapore Sling at the bar - and I think we ordered every thing they had on the breakfast menu, and it was all delicious. Treat yourself - you will not be disappointed. I cannot wait to go back and comment General Manager Patrick Fisher and staff for making us feel like we were regulars.

title: The best Singapore has to offer
desc: If you had not visited Raffles Singapore, you have not visited Singapore. Such rich history, heritage and stories that brings you not just what you can have, but most importantly what you can feel. This is the only place that makes you from a guest to friend and to a family. Looking forward to many many more memorable nights with raffles singapore. Where you are living within legends within a legend.

title: Well located, good service in general
desc: The location is convenient. And overall, the service is excellent. However, our daughter's soft toy was lost after room cleaning, and we mentioned this issue to the butler several times, and no one is actively following this issue. I don't think this should happen at a hotel at this standard.

title: Bucket list stay in a historical gem
desc: A wonderful one night stay with my wife in a Courtyard suite, eating at Tiffin Room for breakfast and evening meal, drinks at long bar, as well as doing the Historical tour on our day of departure. The level of service matches the quality of the hotel.

title: Great Ambience and feel good visit.
desc: Great Ambience. Gives the feel of home and mixture of English and Oriental set up. However the food service in the Tiffin Room was frugal even for a single person and need to enhance quantities for family. However had a good time for dinner with family.

title: Superb Service
desc: We spent a few days at Raffles on our way to Bali. The service was impeccable and everyone was so friendly /warm. They made you feel at home and the in-service butler saved the day and went to the local store for us to find an item we ran out of. If you haven’t done so, book some time with the Raffles historían. He was worked at Raffles for 50 years and will give you a verbal history of how Raffles came to be and how it has changed overtime. Truly enjoyed our short stay at Raffles.

title: Unforgettable Holiday Week at Raffles, Singapore!
desc: We absolutely adored our visit to Raffles Singapore Dec 21-23, 2022! The warm welcome by your uniformed doorman, Hotel Manager Patrick and your entire team truly made us feel like welcome family members coming home for the holidays. We were so impressed that we were able to check in early and were invited to enjoy breakfast upon our early arrival. Both were unexpected gestures of luxury hospitality, and so much appreciated. We felt absolutely pampered. We love the Christmas decor and holiday music, the beautiful Harp and Christmas choir. I will cherish our memories at Raffles, Singapore forever. I had tears of gratitude in my eyes as we walked through your storied front doors, and as we left. Allen from Bell& Concierge desk provided us with the kindest caring assistance

title: A face lift of an old lady
desc: The renovation of the Raffles Hotel is a success. In its ambition to be the best certain things should be changed. The butler service does not work. Skip that and go back to direct contact with who ever you need to reach. Running around with an iPad in order to monitor light, curtains etc is perhaps a generation question. I find that kind of assistance unnecessary. The suits are well and tastefully appointed and the ground are beautifully kept. The magnificent doorman is doing a great job.

title: superb service
desc: the best hotel and service we have ever stayed. checking in and out were smooth inside the suite. the staff are all very friendly and professional. the second night, we asked for in room breakfast and the presentation was fantastic.

title: Luxury bathed in history
desc: Room was cozy and luxurious. We had a very comfortable stay in the room and also enjoyed the various amenities by the hotel. It was a good experience to have the Singapore Sling in the lobby. The history tour was also very informative and enjoyable. We got to see the room that many dignitaries had used! The swimming pool while small had saltwater instead of chlorinated water. Breakfast was good and many options were provided.

title: LUXURY HOTEL WITH GREAT SERVICE AS WOULD BE EXPEced
desc: Seamless experience of great customer service from collection at airport straight to room despite early arrival. Comfortable well appointed luxury room with good turndown as well. Feeling of calm unstated luxury throughout the hotel led to a very relaxing stay, Room - very comfortable however we found. the bedroom a little dark due to the layout of the suites. Bathroom was amazingly beautiful! We hated the automated lights where you need to turn things on and off with an ipad which was a lot of faff….we spoke to other friends that stayed who felt the same but this is really picking holes.. The Butler service is very helpful especially if you wish to get a table at a popular bar or restaurant - they were able to get us in somewhere we couldn’t book directly however it is not a

title: Disappointing, overpriced and poor service.
desc: Sorry everyone but the price of the cocktail was exorbitant. Just ripping off the tourist dollar and capitalises on their name. Staff were disinterested - I am a History teacher and tried to engage them but to no avail. Asked about the setting but nothing!!!!

title: Absolutely fabulous
desc: A truely memorable stay, experience was faultless and the attention to detail given by all staff was second to none. Would recommend taking the opportunity to sample all the dining facilities as service and quality was exceptional.

title: Exceptional service
desc: The service in the outside bar was amazing. The waitress called Narum made us feel very welcome and special. The hotel are very lucky to have such a talented waitress who have contributed to our holiday in Singapore!

title: Disappointed
desc: I had just been staying at the Sofitel Metrepole Legend in Hanoi which is a French Colonial hotel so my view of Raffles is slightly coloured by that experience which was beyond 5 stars. Raffles was nearly the same in terms of building style and room. -Poor welcome at Raffles -The lack of early check-in or check-out as a Platinum member -A message saying they will call between 10 & 12 as we cannot use check out desk due to social distancing. 'I only made one small request of the "Butler" and that did not happen. -The bar gave us the wrong drinks. -At breakfast they could not give me an eggs benedict with salmon without spinach or vice versa. The staff were good but not excellent. Its probably just too much of a tourist destination, never again.

title: Raffles baffles
desc: The refurbished Raffles is impressive physically . Sadly the character is significantly changed. On arrival non residents are unceremoniously directed towards their food outlet of choice which are all now accessed from their external entrances. We dodged our way in to have a look by going via a drink in the writers bar.Excellent cocktails. We have long loved the eccentric feel of Raffles and it’s buzz. The main lobby now has a very smart but very subdued feel. The end of the British era and the start of the French.

title: Impeccable and attentive service
desc: We held our wedding at Raffles Hotel & all our guests, vendors and family only have good words for all the help and great service rendered by the Raffles Staffs. It was such a well pampered stay and we have no other words but a big Thank You to all. Thank you for giving us such a memorable weekend of celebrations.

title: PRESTIGIOUS STAY
desc: from the start to the end of the staycation,we were really awed by the service and the stay. we stayed in the courtyard suite and they have done personalised things for you for the stay. we were celebrating our anniversary and it was a nice touch! glad we have this once in a lifetime experience in raffles Singapore

title: Arrival welcome was a let down
desc: We arrived late (8:30pm) and did not feel as though the staff was interested in giving good service. We never received our arrival Singapore Sling cocktail. Was told all property restaurants were fully booked for dinner that night. When we pressed for just a seat at the bar and snacks we were then told we could have a 9pm reservation. The restaurant called our room at 9:10 and we were told that kitchen was closing at 9:15 (kitchen hours posted online showed 9:45 closing). We rushed down to find an almost empty restaurant and a lot of staff looking as though they wanted to go home. Very uninspired service. Food was good. Not a great start to a 2 night stay but room amenities and breakfast were very good. For a smallish 5 star hotel they need to do a better job on guest

title: Outstanding hospitality
desc: We received the most incredible hospitality and care from Allen in the concierge/ reception area at The Raffles. He approached are group with a genuine warmth, care and initiative to keep us as comfortable and happy as possible. Thank you for your attention to detail.

title: Fabulous
desc: Everything about our stay was exceptional - accommodation, customer service, restaurants, ambience, grounds, so peaceful and relaxing. The housekeeping staff provided such excellent service and they were always there but “not there” - not intrusive but we always returned to find out accommodation with the special touches. Can’t fault anything!

title: Celebrating our joint 60th birthday
desc: My wife and I were jointly celebrating our 60 birthday at the Raffles Hotel in Singapore. The staff was spot on with everything from the greeting as we got out of the limo, to the check in, to the room design/decor, the celebratory decorations, to the high tea and finally, the smooth checkout as well as arranging the flight check. My wife and I thank each and every one of you.

title: Howard’s visit to Raffles Singapore
desc: Visited the Long Bar for the famous Singapore Sling, along with the Monkey nuts. Arrived early and it got busy quickly, atmosphere was electric and the service excellent . Went on to the restaurant for lunch which was exceptional.

title: Another superb stay
desc: This was our third stay here, arriving early pm and getting the usual friendly reception Check in was efficient and our room was ready. We were given a detailed review of our room and the hotel facilities. The only thing that was missing was about the room lighting which was a combination of switches and i-pad controls. The room overlooked the courtyard but was quite and had all you could need. The hotel has gone through a refurbishment but none of the charm and elegance has changed. There are some changes, the Billiard Bar is now an Italian based restaurant, the Raffles Grill is now a French based restaurant. We wanted to go tp the latter but on the first night it was fully booked and closed the next night (Sunday). Due us being there on Chinese New Year most of the

title: Superb service & beautiful accomodation
desc: We had amazing time at Raffles and felt like absolute royalty from the moment we checked in. The check in process was seamless and rooms and spaces throughout the hotel were amazing. We live locally so were able to stay close and make the most of the facilities and space while we were there - which was perfect! Every single member of staff we encounters was extremely helpful, friendly and there was a real personal touch added through their efforts to get to know us a little better. Similarly there was lots of space in our room to relax and store bags etc throughout our stay - including a small dining table for a lovely room service experience and a balcony overlooking the Palm Court to relax on.

title: Lovely visit to Raffles
desc: Excellent visit to Raffles Long Bar for Singapore slings. Great atmosphere. Must mention Harpret the Sikh doorman he was a wonderful help , we arrived in torrential rain and he got us into the hotel dry with a brolly and then took a lot of trouble to get us a taxi as it was Chinese new year bank holiday and none were around so he booked one on his phone on Grab app and made sure it came thank you !

title: A truly top hotel from which to enjoy the highlights of Singapore
desc: An atmospheric experience. Great facilities with excellent staff in a very good location. Our suite was a great size. It included a parlour and with a large slipper bath. Extremely comfortable stay from which to enjoy the highlights of Singapore

title: Birthday to Remember
desc: A city stopover and I cannot fault the hotel; environment, staff, food, service and care taken with each guest. From The moment we arrived, we knew we were staying somewhere special.
