At the same time, the air of the place was of refined calmness. Everything took place quietly and efficiently. You were not made to feel under pressure. You were always made to feel welcome.

title: Perfect end to our trip
desc: We spent the last evenings of our new years trip at Raffles in Singapore and were very very happy with the choice. Everything was absolutely excellent from the reception to taking our photos in front of the christmas tree to our stunning courtyard suite which was so nice (love the re-design, furniture and top notch butler service). We had some special requests from roomservice but nothing was too difficult for them to prepare. Really excellent breakfast as well which we had outside in the morning sun. Loved the rooftop bar by the pool and were in particular impressed by Alex who provided a top tier service all the way, thank you so much Drinks in the evening at the bar were also great and the team provided some complementary drinks as well which we really liked. Came to the

title: Perfection!
desc: My favorite hotel. The best luxury hotel in the world. Everything is perfect, the staff is perfect. Stateroom was very special. Meals and drinks perfect. To is highly recommended as is the Writers bar.

title: Afternoon tea at Raffles hotel
desc: Afternoon tea here is incredible. Gibson was great. Very informative and helpful even though he was busy. The choice is amazing and well worth it. We will definitely do it again as the tea from France is incredible and wish it was available for purchase.

title: Heavenly Raffles Hotel
desc: There just aren’t the expletives to wholly justify just how outstandingly wonderful Raffles Hotel, Singapore absolutely is. We just didn’t want to leave. What a brilliant experience. It should be on everyone’s bucket list. We were there to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary and were treated like royalty. Complimentary flowers, cake, chocolates, champagne, gifts etc

title: Think Twice Before Eating at the Tiffin Rooms
desc: We had a meal at the Tiffin Rooms - Indian food. We live in SG and only come here as a special treat. The Arrival and place are spectacular- however the service / quality Of food vs value ie it’s very expensive especially now ++ is more were very disappointing at the tiffin rooms. It wasn’t busy and yet they were quiet unwelcoming although we had booked and the food although ok was not presented well and the bill chase was a little ridiculous having to ask 3 separate people. Overall on this occasion it took the shine off the event

title: Colonial Jewel
desc: Excellent stay for 3 nights. Sometimes it’s difficult for these grand hotels to live up to the hype but Raffles certainly did. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were superb. Writers Bar is well worth a visit. The cleanliness of every part of the hotel is magnificent even by Singapore standards. Check in and out couldn’t have been easier. If you’re going to Singapore as a one off it’s well worth it.

title: Perfect in every way
desc: Fantastic staff and amazing service. The suite was very stylish and comfortable and had everything we needed. Check in and out was very efficient. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The rooftop pool was very pleasant and relaxing.

title: A truly fabulous hotel
desc: A truly fantastic hotel, we try to make a habit of staying in excellent hotels but raffles is in another league. Starting from our check in, our stay was fabulous. I had built the hotel up before our visit but it surpassed all our expectations.

title: Waste of Money Rude Staff
desc: Shame on you Raffles Horrible Honeymoon Stay. Check in was the worst part the " Personality Suites are really small we refused to stay, we where upsold to a residence room that was larger and we paid for it. The butler service was a joke the butler never answered the phone. After calling several times they would finally pick up. There was not one butler their where young girls who where over worked and under paid. Shame on your General Manager he/she needs to be fired immediately. Also the time room service took was ridiculous over an hour and every time missing something really take an experienced traveler don't waste your money at " Raffales totally over-rated

title: Fantastic special birthday celebrations
desc: My husband and I arrived at Raffles Hotel for my special birthday celebrations for afternoon tea and was in awe of this spectacular building. We were welcomed by the iconic Raffles Doorman and were shown to our lovely corner table. The whole experience was amazing from the afternoon tea, the magnificent hotel, the furnishings, the surroundings and the staff who were friendly and always with a smile. Thank you Raffles team, for making my special day very memorable and making us very feel very special. My gluten free afternoon tea was delicious....thank you so much. After the afternoon tea, we walked to The Long at Raffles. We waited in the queue for about 20 mins and shown to our seats. We ordered the famous Singapore Sling, which went down a treat with the bag of monkey

title: More than 5 Star
desc: Wow. Just Wow. What an incredible hotel. Gorgeous historcial buildings incredibly well maintained and updated. Outstanding service. Geat location. We have been fortunate to travel around the world and stayed at many fine hotels. Raffles Singapore is in a class by itself. One word of warning: you pay for this level of luxury.

title: best hotel in Singapore
desc: I visited in long bar recently .hotel is so beautiful and long bar has superb Singapore sling .i really feel nice to drink my first Singapore sling there . Staff provide me great service .I will give this hotel as five star rating because of nice staff especially Harpreet .he helped me to book taxi and 1 more thing he always smile .great staff great service I will come back again.thank you Raffles hotel.

title: WONDERFUL, RELAXING FAMILY STAY AT RAFFLES
desc: We have stayed at The Raffles Hotel many times over the years, so we know the property extremely well. We booked two Plam Court Suits as we had our daughter, son, daughter-in-law and grandson with us on this trip. The Raffles yet again lived up to its name. We would like to again personally thank Alfani who took care of our booking and also Pradhib, Fitrah ad Alicia our butlers who looked after us during our eight (8) night stay, they were very attentive and helpful and would like to thank them sincerely. Housekeeping staff were very thorough, our rooms were perfectly cleaned, and they certainly had an eye for detail, thank you to the housekeeping team who serviced our rooms. This department is generally overlooked yet plays an equally important role in the running of the hotel

title: Nostalgia in buckets
desc: Nostalgic hotel. Very beautiful- rooms superbly appointed. Staff attentive. A must for those who wish to splash out on an indulgent treat. Loved the Tiffin Room, with a great breakfast. Evening curry at this venue also superb. A little disappointed with afternoon tea as table time limited to one & a half hours & not cheap, not nearly enough time to eat all the treats.

title: The timeless, elegant Long Bar
desc: a Visit to The Long Bar had been on our "bucket list" for quite some time, it was worth the wait , notwithstanding the Covid pandemic adding to the wait. Wonderful ambience, Ella Fitzgerald classic Jazz numbers playing softly, affable people from all over the world. Excellent Staff. Throwing peanut shells onto the floor , as is customary , was difficult at first, but we soon got into the swing of things ! A memorable visit indeed.

title: The only place to stay in Singapore
desc: Amazing hotel. Amazing service. Amazing location. I would not stay anywhere other than Raffles in Singapore. The rooms are spacious and the staff is really helpful in everything and very accommodating.

title: Very welcoming, great location
desc: amazing everything we dreamed it would be & more went here as a bucket list stay with my sister We found the service to be above & beyond what we dreamed it would be from the butler to the personalised historical tour

title: Exceptional stay, wonderful staff and service
desc: An all round wonderful experience. The staff are friendly, helpful and obviously proud of what they do. The room and other facilities are fabulous. The hotel is fabulously situated and if you don't want to leave you can lie around the pool all day.

title: Great experience for the family at Raffles.
desc: Having stayed previously at Raffles shortly after it's 2019 reopening and experiencing the exceptional quality and uniqueness of one of the world's great hotels, we decided to return in February 2023, but this time with our family as well. We were so pleased that our stay at Raffles, Singapore lived up to our expectations. All of the staff were so delightful and helpful. Our experience with food at Raffles was amazing. The facilities were always immaculate, including the bars, gym, pool and surrounds and well serviced. We had the pleasure of having a few discussions with the hotel's Director of Rooms, Ms Grace Kiong, who made us feel a part of the family. She assisted us in any issues and travel assistance and she was a pure delight to liaise with. We look forward to our

title: The Grand Dame of Singapore
desc: The Grand Dame of Singapore. From the moment my wife and I were met at Changi  Airport and stepped into the Raffles Limousine, until we checked-out, was pure luxury. Raffles Singapore oozes legendary delight and courtesy. We had the pleasure of being guests at Raffles to celebrate my birthday in February 2023. The management and staff were impeccable, and the service was totally exceptional. I would recommend Raffles Singapore for anyone wishing to celebrate a special occasion, or just visiting the wonderful Singapore City. The presentation of our room and birthday gifts made our stay most memorable. A personal 'farewell' from the manager made our departure wanting us to return whenever we can (and we will). As a guest of Raffles, I did find the behaviour and dress codes

title: excellent
desc: 2 day visit en route to explore more of Asia. Staff brilliant all round in every department. wouldnt hesitate to revisit or recommend. Lovely oasis in middle of the city. good choice of eateries in or close by hotel.

title: Most comfortable stay at Raffles Singapore!
desc: My family had an awesome stay at Raffles Hotel Singapore! Our visit did not quite start that way. Initially, we encountered some problems upon arrival at the hotel. However, after communicating the issues to one of the staff who reported it to management, the staff more than compensated for our entire stay to make our experience the best we've ever had. The room, amenities, beddings, service and food are all of highest quality. The breakfast selections were plentiful and fresh. The entire staff worked really hard to make our stay most memorable. I love the veranda, the courtyard and the many restaurants within the hotel property. I would like to commend Grace for her awesome leadership and excellent customer service. Her sincerity was evident in everything that she did and truly

title: Beautiful Architecture
desc: I work in upper level hospitality management and even though I believe the hotel staff was very well intentioned, I'm not sure where the disintegration of their ability to transcribe their service took place. There was certainly a break between well-meaning and well-performing and it was quite obvious. It felt uncomfortable, the staff was not relaxed or well informed of the policies or how to procure to the needs of a world executive traveller. I felt like half the time I was having to do their job for them and that made me very frustrated, affected my ability to perform remote work onsite, and to be honest, I left feeling resentment towards your operation and sincerely disappointed for the management team and imagined its forefathers rolling over in their graves at the current

title: Skip the Long Bar. Try the high tea instead.
desc: We decided to do the classic tourist thing while in Singapore. We caught the MTR subway to the iconic Raffles Hotel to enjoy a drink at its famous Long Bar. However, upon arrival, we discovered a highly touristed venue with “tourist park style” billboard posters at the entrance and an entry queue snaking out the door. This didn’t didn’t look or feel anything like an historic five-star hotel experience. We both agreed such a cliche attraction wasn’t worth the wait. However, Raffles redeemed itself on our final day in Singapore. We had time to kill before heading to the airport for a late night flight to London. We booked a late afternoon high tea in the Raffles Grand Lobby. I’m delighted to say that this proved well worth the experience. We enjoyed a relaxing afternoon in its

title: Iconic & not to be missed but disappointed with Afternoon Tea
desc: A visit to Raffles is just one of those things which must be done when in Singapore. Although the website showed Afternoon Tea to be fully booked, we called in to check availability for the following day. Very warmly greeted on arrival at the main entrance and a reservation arranged without issue. We arrived early so as to visit the Longbar and enjoyed the experience. It’s a little pricey (had expected this) but the Singapore Sling & Whiskey cocktail were excellent in a setting with a great atmosphere. Taking afternoon tea in the elegant lobby area is delightful, especially when accompanied by the resident harpist. Being from the UK we have taken afternoon tea in many glorious venues from Harrods right through to majestic stately homes so we have a lot to compare against.

title: Amazing birthday weekend staycay
desc: Decided to stay at the Raffles for my birthday weekend with the Reflections of Raffles. From the moment I was picked up by the hotel limo from my house, the legendary Raffles Experience was truly felt with a warm "Welcome Home" from the familiar faces I consider family away from Home. It was truly a magnificent and relaxing weekend: my suite already prepared with the small details I truly appreciate - the fruit platter with only the fruits I ate, my favourite Tempur pillow, the Green tea aroma diffuser that I truly enjoy in all my previous stays, and a very thoughtful birthday surprise. What stood out this time was the semi-buffet for breakfast - truly luxurious and only the best quality dishes - you come here for quality (and not quantity) - and having my favourite breakfast

title: You just have to visit Raffles when in Singapore!
desc: The hotel is beautiful & most certainly takes you back to a time when everything was so elegant. It’s well worth queuing to get into the Long Bar to enjoy the famous Singapore Sling in such a lovely bar with a great atmosphere.

title: Attention to detail - Outstanding
desc: Raffles Singapore is an iconic hotel. From the moment we were picked up at the Airport, we were on an incredible journey. The hotel is stunning, it is architecturally breathtaking and stunning, with a spacious, calm feel away from a busy city. Our room was amazing, extremely quiet, beautifully appointed bc and the most comfortable bed, there a lots of nice touches which remind you of why you chose to stay here . The staff are wonderful and take care of you, especially your personal butler who can assist to make your stay as enjoyable and memorable as possible, ours was extremely helpful. The food is wonderful and if you want to stay in an iconic hotel, and have an excellent experience I would highly recommend Raffles - it is outstanding!

title: What an amazing experience
desc: Raffles is a hotel which does not leave anything to chance. Fabulous service from the moment of arrival to departure. The staff were amazing, as was the hotel and everything it has to offer. We really felt that the hotel respected us as individuals and couldn’t do enough to ensure we had a great experience.

title: Raffles- The Eighth Wonder of the World
desc: Raffles is an experience that everybody should have at least once in their life. It is a hotel like no other. Beautiful, small, unbelievably tranquil and yet leaving you with a sense of having been at the heart of everything- a tranquil haven at the centre of Singapore. From breakfast in the garden to cocktails in the Long Bar everything about Raffles is so relaxing. This is so much more than a holiday destination. It is a place to visit, if you are lucky to stay- and to come away knowing that you have experienced something very special. If you have the time take up the offer of the Raffles history tour- yes the hotel has a team of historians who will walk you though the hotel describing its origins in fascinating detail even to the point of showing you the Raffles suite where

title: Truly a gem in Singapore
desc: We were here to dine in one of the fine restaurants within the Raffles Hotel. Prior to going into the restaurant, we spent some time walking the grounds of the hotel. The staff were welcoming, genuine and warm, at every turn you could see someone trying to help make your experience in the hotel that bit better. Don't get me started on the architecture of this place, the level of upkeep is high. The grounds were flawless in cleanliness and the gardens were a sight for sore eyes. I hope the team at The Raffles continue what they're doing to make this hotel a Gem in Singapore.

title: Luxury as promised
desc: Very attentive and friendly service, beautiful accommodation and hotel complex following the refurbishment. Excellent breakfast and good choice of restaurants on site. Be aware that early reservations are required for the Tiffin - we were too late to book during our stay

title: This was an overall experience and one we will remember for ever
desc: From start to finish - nothing was a problem. Overall service, quality of food, service, surroundings - loved it. As good a hotel we have stayed at anywhere in the world. Cannot wait to get back there and cannot recommend enough.

title: Afternoon Tea at Raffles - what else need I say?
desc: We enjoyed the Raffles Lobby Afternoon Tea experience with another family couple. It was a great time. The service was excellent, the attention to detail with the food was very good (including covering a separate set of items for one of the party with a specific allergy). The ambience was great, and even included a harp being played live in the background. The only problem was that we were enjoying ourselves (and the company) so much we had to be hurried on a little so the table was released for the next customers! We then walked around some of the public areas of the hotel, but the queue for the Long Bar was, well, too long.

title: Stay at Raffles Singapore
desc: Good stay, although it could be better. There were some neglect in services, but overall, the butlers made up for the little negligence. Breakfast at Tiffin was wonderful every single day. Dinner at Tiffin was a disappointment. I did n’t feel I got good value for the money I spent. The private city tour was great and thank you for arranging a wonderful guide.

title: Maybe good not in our experience!
desc: This hotel maybe living on its past reputation but not a pleasant experience from our point of view. We visited to see the renovated hotel but made as welcome as a leper from front of house & concierge, we asked if we could get a drink in any bar, told the Long Bar for outsiders! Queue 65+ people waiting, went two more bars with empty places, told no if no reservation, waiting for our reserved guests who booked for 5.00 it was 5.30? When l had a conversation with a senior staff member in reception about the changes since our stay some time ago, I was told,”we now cater for the new generation of clientele” We left with help from the only civil staff member the doorman who arranged a taxi.

title: EAT, DRINK, LOVE… THE CHEF❤️
desc: Eat Drink Love .. de Chef This evening at LDDP was a memorable culinary experience. We ate well on your gastronomic offerings… We drank well too But above all - we loved Chef Francesco Thank you very much for the delcious food - your interpretation of Sophie Pic’s food is par excellence ! We enjoyed every bit.., And Josef and his team were great! We’ll definitely be back after our travels.. Until then , stay safe Team LDDP!

title: Practically Perfect in Every Way
desc: This hotel is beautiful. The only hotel room that has ever actually brought tears to my eyes when I saw it. Wonderful restaurants. The historical tour was wonderful. Everyone helps and tends to the guests’ needs with effortless charm and friendliness. Yes, it’s expensive but staying here is an incredible experience that I highly recommend.

title: A happy return
desc: I think this is the best hotel in Asia. I am sure not many in Europe can compare. Definitely not any in the US. Here the service is genuine. In the US they serve you because they want to be tipped generously . Here you don’t have to tip. Only that it is not cheap. But if you can afford it please stay for the experience.

title: Didn't live up to expectations
desc: Had pre-organized with the hotel to have room ready at 1pm, as we were arriving at 1:30 with 2 young kids. Was told this was not an issue. On arrival we were told our room was not ready and could we wait. After 45 minutes waiting in Lobby and still no room ready, we were sent to the pool bar. There we waited for another 1.5 hours. In the end, we told staff we were going to find another hotel as we had 2 kids crying and difficult to manage. They ended up having our room ready. During the stay, we tried to order room service a number of times. The phone kept ringing out and no one would answer. We ended up needing to call reception and butler service to have to kitchen call us to place a booking. On checkout, when we received the bill there were a couple of line items that were

title: Simple the best hotel, ever!!!
desc: Our 2 day stay at the Raffles residence was truly amazing. The hotel, amenities, attention to detail and service was above any other hotel we have ever stayed at. Every single thing is seamless and exceptional.

title: Afternoon Tea
desc: We visited for afternoon tea in the Tiffin. A lovely experience, fabulous service, beautiful setting, fabulous food and champagne. They brought out a small birthday cake and candle for my Husband, a lovely unexpected treat. A must do in Singapore and I would return again.

title: Quite simply, it could not have been better.
desc: Everything was perfect. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful without being at all intrusive. The hotel is a beautiful building which looks as though it has been planted in a field of not-so-beautiful skyscrapers.

title: Raffles Hotel afternoon tea.
desc: Afternoon tea with champagne at Raffles..in a few words,superb,luxury,fabulous. Very highly recommended 👍🏼 the food was delicious,the pastries were perfect,the staff was faultless. We loved every minute.

title: Exceptional
desc: Raffles is pure luxury and the hotel staff including management go out of their way to make you feel pampered. I wish more luxury hotels around the world took a leaf out of their book. We will definitely return to Raffles when we are in Singapore.

title: Exactly How You'd Imagine!
desc: Short but sweet review..... Everything you'd imagine. Had a two night stay here en-route to Bali. The hotel is spectacular, very clean and refined. Food excellent, drinks amazing. Best bit. Avoid the queues for the Long Bar by being able to make a reservation. Walk past the queues. However, the Writers Bar is definitely something else.

title: The Grandest of the Grand Dame’s. 6 Star.
desc: For the last few decades I’ve been comparing all my hotel experiences to a famous hotel I love in Hong Kong which I thought it was unbeatable until Raffles. I don’t know where to start with Raffles because it was all so good. It’s beyond perfect. If there was such a thing as 6 star ratings this would be it. We were met at the front door by two staff members who quickly checked us in away from the front door in a quiet corner of the lobby. After which we were taken to our room and introduced to our room butler who thoroughly explained all the technology in the room which was quickly followed by a welcome drink. The attentiveness of the staff never ended from start to finish. The recently renovated room was perfect “Grand Dame” but filled with technology, the hotel

title: Fabulous
desc: Expensive compared to other brands but well worth every penny Possibly the best hotel I have ever stayed in Staff where awesome History amazing and so relaxing Looking forward to Raffles London and will return here soon Other hotels cannot compete for the space and style of this oasis in Singapore, fabulous gardens and food - outstanding

title: A beautiful piece of history - Raffles
desc: A privilege to have had the opportunity to stay at raffles Singapore . Service was exceptional, palm suites stunning , breakfast delicious , butches block a real treat . A Singapore sling at the longbar ! Not only that the hand written notes to welcome us was greatly appreciated , and the gift to recognise my partners “special birthday “. The bath was divine and the bed linen top notch Nothing was too much trouble at raffles . A truly personalised service Thank you !

title: everything perfect
desc: My guests were overjoyed with the treatment they received at dinner at yi, we were overjoyed with the wonderful reception, kindly and helpful staff and the wonderful facilities. the exceptional pool is wonderful - see if you can find the library!

title: An experience like no other
desc: All expectations and more, were met. The Raffles is an experience everyone should have the pleasure of, at least once. The buildings and ambiance were just stunning, but so too were the lovely staff. Thank you so much. I'll be back.

title: Fabulous service and a joy to be back at Raffles Singapore
desc: So pleased to witness the beautiful restoration of Raffles Singapore. Our stay was as good if not better than ever. The gracious, attentive service is outstanding. Food and beverage offering truly excellent, fault less stay.

title: Exceptional service and understated luxury
desc: Our experience from start to finish was one of exceptional service and understated luxury. We loved the architecture, period furnishings, beautifully maintained rooms, sumptuous breakfast and all the special touches. Our check-in experience with Shermann could not have been better. He was accommodating and helped us fix an error made by our travel agent. The door staff are exceptional - they helped us several times a day when we had friends come over to pick us up or drop us off to the hotel. Roslee, the resident historian gave us an amazing tour of the hotel, and even followed up by sending us photos he had taken for us during the tour. Thank you, to all the staff at Raffles Singapore who made my stay with my parents and daughter such a memorable event.

title: Simply unforgettable.
desc: We were lucky enough to spend five wonderful nights at the iconic Grand Dame and exceptional Raffles Hotel in Singapore just recently. What made our stay so memorable apart from the newly renovated suites and grandeur of Raffles but the friendliness of each of the Raffles team members we encountered on a daily basis. Our family will never forget the experience of being a resident of Raffles even it was for just five nights!

title: Legendary!
desc: Legendary property, amazing experience. Nothing can be faulted, the attention of the staff, attention to details. The suites (all suite hotel) are well designed and the latest refurbishment is just incredible. You don’t even hear the air conditioning system. Comfortable bed and everything is smooth. Well done keep it up!

title: Expensive but worth the visit
desc: Whilst visiting Singapore we had to visit here and have a drink. We had to queue to enter but that is only to be expected given the attraction it is. Once inside we ordered both the traditional Singapore sling the the second version on the menu, and both were excellent. It does feel strange though shelling the peanuts that are on offer and throwing the shells on the floor but it is traditional and so we’re aware only too happy to continue that. Staff are attentive and only too happy to give advice on drinks. It is expensive for a drink but possibly a once in a lifetime visit to Singapore you couldn’t not go even just for the photo opportunity.

title: perfect👍
desc: At first, I chose it based on the hardware only. But the true value of this hotel is in software. I want to visit Singapore again to go to the Raffles Hotel. 처음에 외관만 보고 투숙 결정했는데, 직원분들 서비스가 이 호텔의 정수입니다ㅠㅠ)/ 또 가고싶어요.

title: Wonderful Hotel
desc: Virtually everything was top-notch. Service was outstanding. Our room was delightful and very quiet…even though it faced a busy street. We consider our stay at Raffles to be the BEST hotel stay that we have ever had the good fortune to experience. Highly recommend.

title: Perfect Experience
desc: The Raffles lived up to its reputation. The staff, hotel ambiance, room, restaurants and spa were all fabulous. The personal tour by Raffles's inhouse historian was a real treat. It made our time in Singapore so special. The trip was business / pleasure. It was perfect.

title: Back to colonial days.
desc: The "Long Bar" is a must visit any time in Singapore. Free peanuts on the tables (the husks are swept onto the floor) The drinks are reasonably priced. Personally the Singapore Sling should be missed. The Planters Punch is much better. and a nice refreshing coldie can never go amiss. This is a real throwback to old colonial days, so if you feel that those days are best not remembered then don't go there. I love it. The service is exceptional and the atmosphere is relaxing.

title: Good service to the heart
desc: Every staff we encountered was friendly and made us feel they cared about their guests. I like how the staffs in the lobby prepared our rides and gave us lunch recommendations when asked. My room had a water-running sound at night, and they quickly changed a room for us. And they gave me a gift to show an apology for the trouble, which was sweet. The gift is a small plate with doormen printed, it happened to be a gift I liked, and I was going to buy it from the gift shop, but I did not buy it. I appreciate the staffs' thoughtfulness.

title: Simply wonderful in every way
desc: A very exceptional hotel. From the moment of arrival to the time we left we had exceptional service in this beautifully restored hotel. Our suite was superb with every possible comfort. A very friendly and helpful butler . The grounds of the hotel create an atmosphere of an oasis amongst the high rise buildings. Breakfast was great with fantastic range of options. We enjoyed all the bars and restaurants as well as the pool and spa. Once in a lifetime trip and well worth the effort to get there. Would love to go back. Every hotel now will seem inferior ... Thank you for the fantastic experience.

title: The Long Bar experience
desc: We were a bit sniffy about doing the Singapore Sling bit in the Long Bar especially with the queuing involved but succumbed in the end and did really enjoy it.It did not feel too touristy and service was unhurried. The cocktails were first class and fair value given the surroundings. We got there shortly before 4pm and only waited two minutes to enter.

title: A wonderful Oasis
desc: Raffles is a superbly classy oasis in an amazing yet frenetic city. Nothing was too much trouble. I can heartily recommend this wonderful hotel. Every part of the hotel has clearly been updated in the last few years. You can really feel the history of the place, yet things all have a contemporary twist. Superb.

title: Raffles Singapore Amazing
desc: Raffles Singapore was a truly special, unique experience. Old world feel with first class, modern amenities. We loved our Suite and can’t wait to return to Singapore so we can experience the Raffles again.

title: Raffles Hotel still sets the standard!
desc: My husband and I spent two weeks on vacation in Southeast Asia, and planned to top off our visit with a stay at the famous Raffles Hotel Singapore. We had stayed years ago and had a wonderful time. We were not disappointed as the staff welcomed us with world class service. Every person we encountered inside the hotel was fantastic. And the latest renovations modernized areas in the hotel, without losing its charm! Make sure you have dinner at the Chinese restaurant, which was outstanding! Peking Duck was excellent. Our only observation that did not meet our expectations was the pool area. The service by the pool staff was lacking and the tables around the pool need to be cleaned.

title: Historic
desc: While I visited this hotel many years ago for the famed experience of a Singapore Sling in the Long Bar, could only view it from the outside this time round. The facade is so evocative! Truly a landmark in the city. Amazing how it is so modern yet so traditional!

title: Singapore sling
desc: What a fantastic and impressive hotel, the staff at the entrance are magnificent. the long bar is brilliant, drinks all be it a bit expensive but you only come once... brilliant that you just drop monkey nut shells on the floor and everyone just walks on them.

title: One time drink
desc: As I was in Singapore everyone told me I would have to go here & have the obligatory Singapore sling which I did . The long bar does not open till 12 so we got there at 1155 to find a queue of people waiting but it didn't take long to get in and be seated at the bar. Long story short $37 SD later I have my sling ( which was ok ) and I was on my way 20mins later . Nice to say I have been and done it but wouldn't be doing it again

title: Dream come true
desc: A dream come true. Raffles is everything I expected and more. We were picked up from the airport by private chauffeur. Check in a breeze over a glass of champagne. Our room was a courtyard suite, absolutely stunning and huge. Lovely bars, restaurants and shops to browse. The pool area felt very relaxing. Best scrambled eggs I have ever had for breakfast. It was my husbands 50th birthday and the staff made sure every moment was special. We hope to come back an stay again for another special occasion.

title: Surpasses expectation
desc: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and as far as we are concerned nothing in Singapore comes close to it We saw all the photos before we came but you really have to see it to truly appreciate how beautifully it has been renovated It is spotless. The staff and service excellent We are checking out soon and will be very sad to say goodbye

title: Raffles indulgence
desc: Expensive but I got a good deal for a 3-night stay and have been wanting to stay here for a number of years. It has a brilliant reputation for a reason and of course has had it's fair share of A-list celebrities stay there whose photos are on a brag board. Being built in colonial style everything is dark timber, painted solid plaster walls and sumptuous furnishings. My room was as big as my 2-bedroom unit in Australia! The bathroom had 2 sinks, a bath and a decent size shower that you could have a party in. When you arrive you get taken to your room and every guest gets a butler service. If you want your laces tied or help to find something in your case nothing's too much trouble. The butler shows you how things work and where everything is. I had a twin-share room as I

title: ONE OF LIFE’S RARE EXPERIENCES
desc: Raffles at 1am arrival exudes charm, warmth & extremely helpful staff. This high level of service & professionalism is maintained throughout our stay in this very understated, dignified hotel. A very clever mixture of old and yet contemporary decor. I am optimistic there shall be a Raffles in heaven!

title: Raffles high tea the lowpoint of our trip so far
desc: At about $ 100 SGD a head for high tea, expectations were naturally also high. We were sorely disappointed on all counts: the food was bland, the service was underwhelming (we were left in the hands of a poor trainee) and the wow effect was nowhere to be seen (or felt). The only saving grace was the harp player who unfortunately left us much too soon. Where were the flavours, where was the passion, where was the customer interaction? Would we go back? Definitely not. Unless it was for a refund..

title: A Taste of Royalty!
desc: This experience is but a dream! We travel quite a lot and this hotel is at the to of our list, unmatched service. The grounds are exquisite, you will feel like you are in a fairy tail. Every little last detail is just over the top! This must be what it feels like to be royalty.

title: Perfection - as expected
desc: Enjoyed a very pleasant hour or so here recently. The cocktails are perfect but the food is also outstanding. I had the mango prawns, each succulent and very large. I'd like to try more of the menu as other guests were clearly enjoying the dishes. Looking forward to visiting again soon.

title: Close to perfection
desc: Exceptional service and attention to detail. We requested an upper floor Courtyard suite, but we’re allocated a ground floor room. When we raised this, they immediately arranged a room on the first floor for us in our preferred location, with free Singapore Slings while we waited. Room itself has been modernised since our last stay (large TV’s, tablets to control lights, temperature, TV, blinds etc) but retaining the style and detail within the room. Lots of little touches that make staying here that bit more special e.g. Bottle of wine (change if not to your liking), fresh fruit & chocolates provided on arrival. Free snacks & non-alcoholic beverages in mini-bar. Wooden not plastic bathroom amenities, superior bath robes & slippers, shower stop on temperature to avoid scalding.

title: MAGNIFICENT
desc: We stayed at Raffles for 2 nights in a Courtyard Suite and it was truly magnificent. From the minute you arrive to be greeted by the Sikh doorman to walking into the building via the red carpet, you are made to feel extra special. The hotel is the epitome of grandeur and class and the staff are exceptional. Our suite was very large and beautifully appointed. The breakfast was excellent along with other meals we had there and afternoon tea is a must. Roslee took us for a historical tour of the hotel and it was one of the most interesting tours we have ever had. We had the most amazing time and would rate this as the best hotel we have ever stayed in by a long way. We would highly recommend this hotel and we cannot wait to return.

title: Indulgent trip for my wife’s birthday.
desc: Absolutely amazing destination, much more than just a hotel. A full week of pure indulgence and luxury. Would recommend the birthday spa experience, Tiffin room for dinner & breakfast, Yi for dinner, courtyard for early evening drinks, writers room for sheer quality drinks and the pool for all day relaxation.

title: Close to Perfection
desc: What a welcome! As soon as our car had stopped at the entrance, the iconic Sikh Doorman opened the door and warmly welcomed us to Raffles Hotel. Standing behind him was a member of the lobby team who escorted us, through the impressive and immaculate lobby, to the comfortable reception area. Check-in was handled efficiently and swiftly following which we were escorted to our suites. As soon as we arrived in our suites the Butler introduced herself, talked us through some equipment in the room and invited us to call her if we required any assistance. We did call her on a few occasions and our requests were dealt with swiftly. Our suites were spacious and comfortable. We loved the decor, which fitted in so well with the Raffles name and history. We stayed in the Palm Court

title: piece of Singapore history
desc: The Raffles Hotel is a piece of Singapore history. The British-style doorman is write out of a PBS documentary. The lobby, the restaurants, the staff, and the atmosphere are very interesting. This is a beautiful hotel, with lots of tradition.

title: Must see Raffles
desc: We had to go for a singapore sling or two at the famous Raffles hotel. The building itself is fantastic with beautiful gardens and architecture. We didn't stay at raffles but had to make this a priority visit

title: THE EPITOME OF A FINE HOTEL!
desc: I've heard and read about The Raffles Hotel since I was a youngster. The Raffles lived up to their reputation as a creme de la creme establishment! From the greeting by the staff member handling our check-in to the personal visit from the guest manager, to the beauty of the entire grounds and structure - all was beyond expectation. The afternoon tea was excellent. We were delighted to have a complimentary limousine provided for our early-morning flight to Australia.

title: Best stay in singapore
desc: Had an amazing stay at Raffles! The staff and butler was attentive and attended to all my requests and needs! The breakfast spread was luxurious, highly recommend trying the breakfast in the morning. Lovely stay, will be back!

title: Had tea and a Singapore Sling at the Long Bar
desc: We did not stay here but instead stayed at the Fullerton Bay. We did, however, have tea here and a Singapore Sling at the Long Bar. The tea was rather mechanized and the staff seemed very much disinterested. The tea in London at the Fortnum and Mason tea salon is much, much better. The Long Bar was interesting to see and to taste the Singapore Sling. We came to the hotel to do both the iconic tea and taste the Singapore Sling and left somewhat unimpressed. If you have to do one or the other, go to the Long Bar and skip the tea.

title: The bar that needs furniture
desc: I was disappointed with The Long Bar at the Raffles Hotel. I expected to have some seating arrangement since there is space for it all along the veranda. People were standing waiting in line, no seating, for what would seem to be more than 40 minutes to get the cocktail. It made no sense. And the line was long, very long…The hotel is beautiful, but not accommodating for people who just want to see it and have the cocktail. Not very gracious from this experience.

title: Almost perfect
desc: Our stay at Raffles was fantastic. Every detail about the hotel is great - staff are excellent, hotel is spotlessly clean, rooms are huge and well appointed with every possible amenity imaginable, breakfast was excellent and the Long Bar is a must for the iconic Singapore Sling. There was only one area where we felt our stay fell short and that was Afternoon Tea. We have stayed at Raffles in the past and had Afternoon Tea several times. I have always recommended it to friends who are visiting Singapore. However, on this occasion the standards have appeared to have slipped dramatically. The quantity and choice of food is not nearly as good as before with no savoury snacks or additional cakes to choose from, no-one offered a top-up of tea and generally the service was a bit hit or

title: Highly recommended
desc: Whenever we have a stopover in Singapore we visit Raffles, either as overnight guests or simply for a meal. On this occasion we just had breakfast prior to taking our flight. The food was delicious, service outstanding and the staff very professional. We had time to browse the shopping area and again we couldn’t fault it. From the moment we arrived at Raffles everything was perfect.

title: Must stay in Singapore
desc: Good experience to stay in this luxury hotel. Room and bed is comfortable. Enjoy the city walk and surrounding. Nice lobby coffee area and very friendly staff. Singapore is such convenient city we enjoy every moment in the city.

title: You have to do it- that is all I can say!
desc: I was completely blown away by the experience. Staying here was a lifetime bucket list for me to tick off. I expected something pretty good, but this was on a whole other level again way above any other world renowned five star hotel I've stayed in. Everything about the place is exquisite and the attention to detail from the refurbishment a few years ago really tells. The colonial feel has been retained superbly, yet the rooms are surprisingly modern with technology utilized to the full. I want to come back. I would definitely recommend getting a booking deal that includes breakfast. The Tiffin Room buffet breakfast is the finest I've seen anywhere, fantastic service and the setting is gorgeous. All of the staff are well trained and deliver a very high standard of

title: Excellent stay at raffles.
desc: You get what you pay for. Amazing hotel with incredible staff. We have visited Singapore many times but this was the first time in Raffles. We have great service elsewhere in Singapore but raffles is a cut above the rest. Try he hotel staff genuinely care about your stay and will do everything to make your stay amazing. Bars, restaurants and pool area were all top quality. We loved our visit and will return.

title: The best hotel I have ever stayed in
desc: From arrival on the forecourt to transport to the airport - unparalleled service and luxury. All 'rooms' are suites with a personal butler, top level quality and easy to use technology. All staff were lovely- the resident historian chatted to us at breakfast, the door staff welcomed us 'home', staff knew our names and we felt very relaxed at all times. Breakfast excellent in the beautiful Tiffany room, gorgeous afternoon tea and brilliant fun in the Long Bar drinking Singapore Slings and chucking peanut shells on the floor. Lovely touches such as a personal key fob to keep, credit in the classy Raffles boutique and chocolates and cakes in the stunning suite. The only minor issue was the pool staff were not as calm and efficient as everyone else. Thanks to Raffles for a

title: High Tea Experience
desc: My friend and I visited Raffles for the Sakura High Tea - we booked this experience via their website. Everything about this hotel, and the tea was luxurious and high end. We were greeted at the door by very friendly staff, entered the foyer to the beautiful sound of a harpist. We were running about 15 mins early to our booking, the staff immediately took us to our seats and made us feel comfortable. The tea and coffee selection was great, champagne was available for purchase at an extra cost if that is your thing. All of the dishes were absolutely divine. I highly recommend this experience to anyone who has the opportunity to enjoy 🌸🌺

title: Raffles Singapore sling experience
desc: Visited the Ling bar for a Singapore sling. Was a great experience. We got here a little early, the doors open at 12. The building is so beautiful to look at. Your not allowed in the main hotel unless you are a guest. The staff at the long bar were very friendly. We were served quite quickly. In the time we were there the bar tender must of made in excess of 200 Singapore slings !!. You have a few different options for the Sling, with one at 800 dollars !!. We opted for an original which was lovely. It's an expensive experience, but we enjoyed ourselves. Most people have a sling and are off, within 30 minutes of arriving. It's very busy for the first couple of hours. There is no dress code. You don't have to come via the front of the hotel to access the Long bar, the street

title: Pure luxury
desc: Warmly greeted by staff, taken to our room within 20 minutes, amazing tea and food. We had also been in October, equally as good. Price was a bit expensive but so worth it. Beds are so comfy, given food as we came in, it was an amazing luxurious hotel. With people playing the piano AND the harp for us. It felt as if we were being treated like a queen. Overall, a great hotel to stay at and would highly recommend

title: One of those things you must do!
desc: This is a must do. I had the Singapore Sling and my husband had the original 1915 Sling. Tyhe former is sweeter than the latter. We went middle afternoon and there wasn't a queu. Bar waiters were very friendly and informative.

title: Awful!
desc: I visited the hotel in April 2023 with a local friend. When they greeted me at the entrance, the guy at the entrance asked what I was doing there. I said I wanted to make a booking. He directed me to speak to 2 ladies standing at a booth outside the entrance - this really turned me off right away - how could they service a potential guest by "dealing with me" outside the entrance??? I asked to be "serviced" inside and not outside the entrance. And almost with hesitation, one of the ladies ushered me inside. While I was going in, I saw some robot walking clients around the building. I was thinking "you have got to be kidding? The hotel charges minimum $1800 per night and you don't even have a personal bell boy to help you around the building?" Needless to say, I was

title: Classic…
desc: A stunning journey back in time. Truly historic, and luxurious. Top class staff and professionalism all round. Be sure to visit Long Bar for the famous ‘Singapore Sling’ (and, unlike me, make a mess with your peanut shells).

title: Incredible bygone era stay in a modern metropolis
desc: Raffles Singapore is everything you expect it to be and more. The level of series is exceptional and the standard of the rooms, facility communal areas are breathtaking. Our boys loved having the roof top pool to themselves and we loved visiting Long Bar. Staying at the hotel your butler will precooked a table so you can jump the queue. It's a small taste of a different era in the heart of an ultra modern city.

title: THE best place to stay in Singapore
desc: Raffles hotel is truly the best place to stay in Singapore. The beautiful and historical hotel, the amazing lobby, the impeccable rooms and large balcony and the best is the service. We felt like we were home and there was no request that was turned down or not done. The staff go out of their way to make you happy and that allowed us to have such a memorable vacation. We will not stay anywhere else in Singapore.

title: Allen the concierge is a true superstar
desc: Please can you pass on our sincere thanks to Allen who was manning the main entrance this evening, he is a credit to your organisation. Allen was so knowledgeable about the hotel & it’s history, he made our visit a truly memorable experience. Thank you Allen, you’re an absolute star!

title: Poor Service Afternoon Tea Raffles Hotel - do not recommend
desc: Raffles Hotel Afternoon Tea on Sat 01 April - poor service. Obvious that the female matradee relied on the Hotels fine name rather than provide any real customer service. Advised table not ready, seated guests arriving later before our family, when seated for afternoon tea missed order items, forgot to bring ordered water. She was arrogant and I felt sorry for staff working for her. Would not recommend having high tea there. The door staff were gentlemen, the harpist was amazing, the building spectacular. The S$80 pp was not worth the money.

title: Very nice night nice staff
desc: Went to Raffles for a drink or two wife had Singapore sling I had pint had to wait 20 minutes to get in so not bad very nice had a few nuts 🤪 took pictures very nice time ⌚ left after 2 hours 3 beers 10 pm lots of people still trying to get in lovely time you will probably only do it once so go a enjoy it

title: Singapore Sling in the Long Bar
desc: First time visits to Singapore must include visiting Raffles Hotel to drink the iconic Singapore Sling. The place to do so, is the Long Bar which is located on the first floor of the hotel. This beautiful bar has been caringly restored to reflect yesteryear. There is often a queue to get in the door and a Singapore Sling will cost you $39 SGD. you are also served a bag of peanuts for your table to eat and have the novelty of throwing the shells on the floor. This gin based cocktail is delicious and other drinks are also available. A great tick off your bucket list.

title: One of the world’s best hotels
desc: Remains one of the truly great hotels of the world! From the impeccable service to meticulously maintained buildings, gardens, rooms (sorry suites) and superb restaurants the hotel is the epitome of luxury. Staying there is a wonderful experience. Magnificent in so many ways.

title: Holiday stop over
desc: We have been to Singapore many times before but this time we wanted to try the old charm and history related to raffles. We were not disappointed, the service is on another level. From pick up at the airport to butler greeting in our room the whole experience was top draw. Unlike some other top end hotels this was achieved with a real warmth and friendliness that really endeared. Whilst there is no doubting it is expensive but the feeling of understated luxury and comfort will soon have you forgiving the cost. I would pay the extra for that feeling.

title: Not quite what we expected
desc: Had tea here and a Singapore Sling at the Long Bar. Tea was just OK. Had much better at Fortnum and Mason’s tea salon in London. Spoke with others who stayed here who said they had stayed previously before the renovation and COVID, and the service was much better. We had the same service experience at the Fullerton Bay (see our review if interested). Guess hospitality was another COVID casualty.

title: Nostalgia
desc: Just for the nostalgia it’s well and truly worth experiencing. The bar opens at 12 noon so make sure you get there before that. Other wise you will need to wait outside until someone leaves. It gets very busy on weekends so be prepared for crowds. The famous Singapore Sling is lovely. The only criticism I have is there should be a selection of small finger foods. Peanuts is your truly only option. If you want to enjoy a few drinks it might be sensible to byo your own snacks.

title: Historical Hotel, good experience, but not spectacular…
desc: Good Historical Hotel , Grande, Timeless and Classic Hotel.. It’s a good experience to try once this historical hotel, but in future, i’m not sure whether gonna stay in this hotel again. Everything was OK, but nothing special also. There is nothing “wow” factor for Raffless Singapore eventhough they set their price not cheap. Been to Raffless Istanbul, Bali, and Jakarta. Their staff service was the poorest among all.

title: A simply fantastic experience!
desc: Our stay at Raffles was all that we hoped it would be. Our suite was luxurious, particularly the bathroom with its inlaid marble floor which was absolutely stunning. No attention to detail had been spared - there was even a pillow for the bath. The staff were all so friendly and made us feel very welcome. Particular mention should be given to Roslee Sukar, the hotel's resident historian, who took us on a guided tour of the hotel. Roslee's enthusiasm for Raffles shone through and we would recommend anyone staying at Raffles to take the tour with Roslee. Our suite came with its own butlers, Reena and Thyra, who left me a lovely card, balloons and a little birthday cake for my birthday which was a lovely touch. The breakfast buffet was excellent. We enjoyed drinks in the Long Bar

title: Just amazing
desc: My fifth time in Singapore so decided to finally cross this off the bucket list. It's pricey but completely worth doing at least once. If you've seen the photos and YT vids you already know you can expect a very high level of poshness in the facilities and amenities and the service lives up to its reputation. Room was ready at check-in (at 9am!) and we were upgraded from a Courtyard Suite to a Palm Court Suite. Bags were delivered promptly and our butler gave us a sit-down to explain the room workings, etc. We casually mentioned wanting to "drop in" at the Long Bar later in the evening and he highly recommended allowing him to secure a reservation for us. We were super thankful because it turns out the line was crazy long at 9:45pm on a Tuesday night! But thanks to our butler

title: Our “bucket list” stay at Raffles
desc: We were so looking forward to our 4 night stay at Raffles and right from checking in, to our limousine airport transfer upon checking out, it did not disappoint. We were greeted upon our arrival, our check in was extremely simple and quick, and we taken to our suite for our first look. The courtyard suite was everything we expected it to be luxurious, spacious and had everything we needed. Our wonderful butler, Sunny arrived and he showed us through the workings of the suite and then we sat down to our welcome drink, which was a Singapore Sling. This was one of many hi-lights throughout our stay, everything about the hotel itself was stunning, the amenities, bars, pool area, we could not find fault. We enjoyed a wonderful high tea in the lobby and a exquisite dinner one night in

title: A beautiful hotel with lovely staff and well situated in the heart of Singapore.
desc: My wife and I stayed at the hotel whilst on Honeymoon for two nights. It’s a very cleans newly renovated hotel, well situated for avid shoppers and people who want to experience urban Singapore. The hotel food was delicious and the staff were absolutely spotless in their execution of our requests. The hotel took extra care to write a handwritten card, offer a nice bottle of champagne and make our honeymoon experience very memorable. I highly recommend raffles to other travellers

title: Can't Fault It
desc: We have stayed at the Raffles many many times and it never disappoints; it truly is our home away from home. We stayed in a Palm Court Room this time, which we have stayed in before, these are located in the grass central courtyard area, a great location. Rooms are very clean; staff are very accommodating and breakfast in the Tiffin room is wonderful. Thank you to all who make our stay wonderful and will see you again soon.

title: Impressive welcome surprises!
desc: We decided to take some time off to celebrate or wedding anniversary and my wife's birthday (her birthday is one day after our anniversary). Not being our first time staying at Raffles hotel, we expected to be treated very well, and we were, but it went beyond our expectations... When we arrived at the room it was decorated for our wedding anniversary with balloons, love signs, and they 'sculpted' two swans kissing with our bath towels on the bed, and some nice food, it was marvelous and were so happy, we did not expect so much... its a memorable experience! And on the next day ,on my wife's birthday, they gave her a small cake... Thumbs up, perfect stay, even though the pricing is quite steep...its worthwhile!

title: A Magnificent Day at Raffles
desc: We recently spent 24 hours at Raffles as the perfect ending to a 3 week holiday in Egypt. We arrived around 6am on Saturday morning. Raffles kindly allowed us to have our included breakfast on arrival rather than the following morning. Breakfast was wonderful, with many lovely fruits, meats, cheeses and pastries available along with a a la cart hot dish. Our rooms were not ready so early, so after breakfast we were able to relax by the pool. Once ready, we were taken to our magnificent suites. They had also upgraded us to bigger suites. Once inside the suite we were totally blown away by the size and the opulence of the suite. It was so much more than we had been anticipating. We spent the remainder of the day relaxing in our suite until dinner. Our butler had made reservations

title: Wow !
desc: Be warned, once you stay at Raffles it’s very hard to stay anywhere else. Simply beautiful. The hotel is incredibly gracious , the service that we experienced matched. I’m already planning my next stay .

title: I'll be back!
desc: I cannot write enough good things to say about the newly restored Raffles. I felt like a million dollars from arrival to departure. I stayed in the Charlie Chaplin Suite (201) just stunning modern touches without forgetting the Hotels rich history. Many other hotels can learn from the touches this hotel has in place.

title: Jewel in the heart of the city
desc: Think of a white ornate magical grand building steeped in history. Then add ultra-proffesional Butlers and top class Restaurant staff working in wonderful luxurious interiors and themed restaurants (including Michelin rated) - then you have found something very very special. My wife and I have just enjoyed 7 nights in this beautiful place. Everything about it is World Class. Raffles Hotel Singapore is so captivating that my wife did not go outside of the hotel grounds for the whole of the stay and that says something.....

title: Best hotel, experience in the world.
desc: Outstanding in every way! World-class, exceptional staff, service and attention to detail. Reputation is warranted for history, class and inclusion. Best in the world, looking forward to returning to further explore the luxury and service.

title: What an experience.
desc: On our visit to Singapore we thought we’d have afternoon tea at Raffles hotel in the lobby. I’ll be the first to admit that it is expensive S$88 each but it’s all about the experience. The staff were brilliant, from doormen to the servers. We couldn’t fault any of them and it was great to dress up & take some time to slow down after a few hectic days around Singapore. The scones were to die for, fresh & warm. An amazing experience and one that we’re so glad we did. One to tick off the bucket list.

title: A diamond in the centre of Singapore
desc: World class in every sense - Location is perfect, Hotel buildings are awe inspiring, Restaurants top class , Fitness centre is modern, has the latest kit and is very clean. All supported by wonderful team of ultra efficient and delightful staff. Stayed for 7nights and never left the Hotel grounds - its was that good.

title: Iconic luxury made this such a memorable stay
desc: We stayed here for 2 nights on a layover to Sydney. Being so iconic, this was our first choice. We arrived very early in the morning, too early to get to our room, but the night porter took us to the gym where we showered and changed. Our room (234) was upstairs near the Long Bar, had a living room, which was really handy, a large bedroom and a really large bathroom with a standalone bath, plus a separate shower and toilet rooms. It was all extremely clean and fresh and even came with a butler (a first for us). She offered us complimentary Singapore Slings, which we gladly took after we had taken a nap. We went to the Long Bar that evening for another. We had a lovely breakfast the next day and had even booked afternoon tea for later that day. Sadly we had to leave early

title: World famous location for THE Singapore Sling
desc: Went with a friend to show her the famous Long Bar and introduce her to the world-class service of this location. We weren't disappointed, the Singapore Sling is amazing (so were all other drinks, too), the waitresses and waiters were great and the atmosphere is just right to hang out with your bestie on basically any nigh of the week. You can't eat that many peanuts, but it's is a lot of fun to throw the shells on the floor (it's a tradition). At the Hotel Allen proved again that Raffles is first class and offered best service, we highly appreciated his fast support. Will definitely come back (again and again)!

title: Pure Luxury
desc: My wife and I decided to spoil ourselves at one of the world's luxury hotels, we were not disappointed. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff were attentive to our every need, it was an absolute pleasure to stay there. We are coming back (at some time) to re live the experience

title: Raffles hotel Singapore - concierge service.
desc: Have met amazing personality at my 1st day at Raffles hotel Singapore. His name is Allen, concierge with high sense of Raffles hospitality and great willingness to show around and extend any kind of support to the guest. Truly Raffles concierge-Allen, search for him!

title: Incredible
desc: Amazing place and we loved Harpreet at the front!!!! We had the most wonderful evening at this stunning hotel and following a few Singapore slings at the long bar, we wanted to get some pictures to remember the moment, in which, Harpreet at the front was happy to take for us. He was so kind and likeable and really got us some good angles! Thank you Harpreet🥰

title: Best experience of my life
desc: I could not fault raffle’s. The best experience of my life. We were mad to feel like royalty. The rooms were amazing , whole hotel spotless and staff very friendly. Highly recommended. We will be back.

title: First class hotel, first class experience.
desc: I first visited Singapore over 40 years ago and promised myself that if I returned I would stay at Raffles. It surpassed all my expectations and the memories of my time at this wonderful hotel will stay with me forever. To be honest, I just don’t know where to begin and only wish we had stayed longer. From check in to check out it was just perfect. We stayed as a special treat for my birthday and every member of staff pulled out all the stops to really make it a birthday to remember. Our room was stunning, with a cake, balloons and a decorated table. The butler took a picture and delivered a hard copy 20 minutes later. She also left me a gift bag that I found on the table when I woke up in the morning. I was also given a small cake when we went for afternoon tea. There was so

title: Tranquil and calm
desc: We love it that the hotel offers a tranquil atmosphere. We were made to feel special the moment we stepped into the hotel. The butler service is an experience that is worth mentioning. Mom was treated with much care by the hotel staff.

title: The Long Bar is a must
desc: When in Singapore you have to visit the Long Bar. You can feel the history as you walk into the hotel. The staff are helpful and welcoming. At least one of your drinks has to be a Gin Sling (they even do a non alcoholic version). Apart from the peanut shells on the floor (which of course is part of its history and ambiance), the bar is clean and comfortable. A great place to cool down and escape the humidity.

title: A special romantic getaway.
desc: A magnificent old world hotel, with every mod con and with staff that can't do enough for you. The rooms are all suites, and a butler helps you organise everything you need. Bed and Pillows are soft and fluffy, with a pillow menu available.

title: Why stay anywhere else?
desc: One of the world's truly grand and gracious hotels. Staying there was a special experience in every way and lived up to every expectation. Having first visited 40 years ago it was a delight to see this magnificent hotel restored to its former glory.

title: There are hotels and there are five star hotels and then there is RAFFLES!
desc: Raffles is a destination not just an historic Hotel. Everything about this hotel has a degree of magic - the service, the facilities, the food and most importantly, the staff actually take the time to know who you are and attend to your every requirement. For many, a stay at Raffles is atop the 'Bucket List'. You will not be disappointed! Come for the comfort, stay for the enjoyment, soak up the history and leave with memories to last a lifetime!

title: YOU.JUST.HAVE.TO.VISIT..... even if only once in your lifetime!
desc: How can one not pop in for a drink? This has been a family standard for many, many years. I last visited just after the renovations in 2019 and happy to return for afternoon cocktails. Service as always spectacular; and the Rose even more so! Close enough to MTR, or if you can't be bothered, hook a cab outside.

title: The best of the best this hotel is amazing.
desc: This was one on my bucket list I have admired this stunning hotel all my life and I so wanted to stay here. We enjoyed a few days here on our return from the Maldives. It was absolute luxury it was the most amazing hotel in the world it was so beautiful the foyer was stunning with the largest arrangement of fresh flowers I have ever seen. The rooms were luxe and we loved the balcony off the rooms along with the swimming pool gym and bar area perfect to enjoy after a day out in Singapore. The afternoon treats that the staff kindly dropped in daily were delicious. The rooms were lovely and large and had a sitting room and table too so there was more than enough space. The bathrooms were gorgeous with a large bath. Beautiful linen and the rooms were immaculate. The staff were

title: Unparalleled Elegance
desc: Raffles Singapore is one of the most iconic hotels in the world for good reason. This hotel exudes old world class, elegance, and sophistication. The Colonial architecture and design is breathtaking, elegant, and luxurious but also welcoming and warm. Everything, from the grandeur of the building down to the light switches, has been meticulously designed. Raffles undoubtedly is one of the best hotels in the entire world and arguably the finest in Asia.

title: Fabulous 4th time with family
desc: Always amazed by raffles.... I don't have enough words to describe the oppulance and amazing staff. Amazing food and drinks, service and just overall style. Not many places you can go to in the world that make you feel like this.

title: A visit to Raffles is a must do when in Singapore.
desc: We went to Raffles to see the new upgrades and to have high tea. We were greeted but the doorman who made sure we had some great photos taken. We enjoyed a high level of service with an amazing selection of pastries and food. We later went to the Long Bar to have a Singapore Sling to top off the event. This was a must do for us and loved every minute.

title: Raffles sets the bar high
desc: Have been wanting to stay at this iconic hotel for years. From the moment we arrived until check out the service standard was very high and we had high expectations. The room and hotel was spotless . We loved the location as is was a bit further away from busier areas. Dining was also exceptional. Will definitely return

title: Pathetic
desc: My whole reason for coming to Singapore was to have a Singapore Sling. I arrived at the hotel greeted by an extemely grumpy doorman, especially when he saw I was not a guest. Mumbled which way I have to walk, looked forever to find the bar to be told they closed five minutes before. So you know what thanks for nothing. I will just drink it on my Singapore flight home.

title: Beautiful and Memorable Stay
desc: My family and I had an excellent stay this past weekend at the Raffles Hotel! The true highlight was the staff, as we needed an extra bed and an extra party to join us for breakfast and the staff accommodated us for no extra charge. The complimentary in-room snacks were delicious (we devoured the chocolates), and the room service was superb and accommodating since we had to rush to leave before an event. The hotel’s architecture was beautiful; Raffles has done an excellent job of preserving their long history while modernizing their facilities, which was much appreciated. I cannot recommend Raffles enough and if you have the time, even just visiting their iconic lobby is well worth your time.

title: Raffles doesn't want you to visit
desc: Don't go. Went to see the historic lobby and they treated us like trash. Chased us and told us to leave. When we said just like to see the beautiful lobby we were told no. Guess they don't want guests.

title: Amazing Afternoon Tea in the Grand Lobby
desc: Afternoon Tea in the Grand Lobby was just an amazing experience. We went thinking it would be great and it was incredible. The service and attention to detail were second to none. We enjoyed a glass of champagne and between the sandwiches, pastries and scones we did not even need dinner that night! The presentation of everything was fantastic and with flower arrangements and a piano and harp playing it was heavenly. It was the top experience of our week in Singapore and if we visit Singapore again we will repeat it.

title: Excellent
desc: Went here for my partners birthday and had afternoon tea. All I can say is absolutely fantastic. The place itself is very impressive. The tea was amazingly well presented and the attention to detail was second to none. Overall a brilliant experience and so glad I'd booked it.

title: 5 stars hospitality
desc: Amazing 5 stars hospitality. Surroundings is lovely, team is warm and welcoming. Room is spacious and quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable. I booked the State Suite and enjoyed the space and interior very much.

title: Raffles Luxury
desc: As expected, we had an amazing stay at Raffles Singapore. The rooms are spacious, luxurious and immaculately clean. The service is next level from all staff onsite. We dined/drank at the Tiffin Room, Courtyard and Long Bar (of course) during our stay and all were excellent. Whilst the prices for food and drinks are a bit over the top, even for a luxury hotel like this, it was still a great experience.

title: Tick box experience completed.
desc: Clean and tidy(except the peanut shells). Very friendly staff, we didn't have to queue long. Expected very expensive drinks but a box ticked in life. One time only experience in the long bar. Ignore the price and enjoy. The nuts are free so fill your pockets. 😁

title: Family Short Stay Treat at Raffles Singapore
desc: We had a wonderful stay at The Grand Dame! This was our second visit to Raffles Singapore in nine months and it certainly didn't disappoint. On this occasion we upgraded to The Lady Sophia Suite, this is one of two Promenade Suites at the very front of the hotel on the third floor. If you have watched the documentary on the hotel renovations, this is the suite where they struggled to get a TV into the bedroom! Well, they have done a great job with all of the renovations. If you can push the boat out to stay in one of these suites I would highly recommend it! We had welcome drinks in The Writer's Bar, it is so atmospheric and the mixologists produce some great cocktails. On our first evening we ate in The Tiffin Room, this really is a Singaporean institution, the food and

title: Amazing hotel fantastic service
desc: Excellent hotel with amazing services. It’s the small touches and service beyond the amazing hotel that make it above and beyond the other hotels we enjoyed during a 6 week trip to Europe. The staff were friendly and helpful, with a personal touch that made us feel welcome and at ease. Pool is also fantastic, perfect temperature - you just walk right in there’s no initial chill to get used to before being comfortable. And the rooms are even bigger and better than they look in the photos.

title: Exceptional
desc: Upon arrival we were immediately whisked away to our room where we were privately checked in and a few minutes later a staff member arrived to show us around the stunning suite which was so spacious and beautifully decorated. Reasonably priced room service and the breakfasts were delicious with an extensive menu. There is a tour of the hotel available to learn the history of the hotel and be entertained with stories of guests who have visited the historic hotel with photos taken along the way and later emailed to the guest.

title: A visit to the Long Bar for a Singapore Sling, negroni and nuts.
desc: Met Allen at reception who was very kind and accommodating in assisting us with some photos and recommending the famous Singapore Sling at the Long Bar. It was great having a brief tour of the hotel and having a evening drink with the family at Raffles Hotel. All staff we met at Reception and Long Bar, were lovely and knowledgeable about the history of Raffles Hotel. We will definitely be back to visit on our next trip to Singapore.

title: Inconsistent ….3.5 rating for a hotel that should always be a 5!
desc: This is a visually stunning hotel with wonderful ambience. We have always wanted to stay and experience the famed Raffles service. Unfortunately our stay missed the mark more than once. Upon arrival we were greeted by Vicki who was very welcoming. We were checked in early which was very much appreciated and we by no means expected that. We were also given an upgrade to a Parlour room (absolutely stunning and sumptuous). The automation system in the room is the best we have experienced….and the bathroom, especially the floor inlay truly opulent. Vicki took us to the room and told us that the Butler would come and explain the room and hotel ammenities. We waited for a good half hour… no butler. So disappointing as this is what Raffles is known for … the Butler service. Due to this

title: Legendary Service Since 1887 - with some minor issue
desc: My last stay at Raffles Singapore was in 2019. They just opened after extensive renovation. I was planning to stay there again in 2020 but the great plague hits the world and many plans change or cancelled altogether. And so I manage to return recently. The property still as great as before. And the service still as amazing as before. And this time I also have the opportunity to try their Michelin Starred restaurant, La Dame de Pic. It was wonderful. However there are some issues that I believe the management needs to address. Accor ALL recognition seems to be non existant here. None of benefits that available for ALL Diamond is not offered, and even request about 1pm late check out was refused straight away. I do hope the management could pay more attention on

title: Great service and ambience
desc: Learning about the hotel's history and the traditional uniforms was fascinating and overall we had a wonderful cultural experience. Our visit began and ended with a young, smiling Sikh doorman at the main entrance who greeted us warmly and kindly offered to assist us in navigating the hotel. His professional understanding of the hotel and local area's heritage was interesting and insightful and much appreciated with it being our first trip to Singapore. He also provided us with a taxi in no time upon leaving which made us feel pampered in the midst of jetlag! The long bar staff were so friendly and accommodating and the place had such a cosy, relaxed ambience despite being so popular during our time of visiting. The hotel grounds are well worth an explore and the abundance of

title: Overpriced
desc: No doubt a beautiful hotel food and service . But OVERATED and o OVERPRICED. The end charge was 200 pounds more than quoted and I think they bank on people being Too polite and embarrassed to say anything but it's dishonest and I don't like that. The Dorchester Ritz in London is superior.. Im blessed to be able to experience this hotel but on reflection the reality is that's its just very overpriced . There are many great hotels in singapore for a fraction of the price . I will never make the mistake and stay in a hotel just for the name again .

title: Magical
desc: I had been wanting to try this hotel for a long time. It was magical. In a world where so many city hotels look the same, this hotel is refreshingly unique with absolutely breathtaking colonial architecture. I could spend all day just walking through the hotel. Service was generally excellent, from the concierge to our wonderful butler Luqman. History tour by the resident historian is a must and is a really great way to understand the heritage of the place. I thought even the entry level rooms had character and a very good size (as one would expect for the price). We visited a number of hotels in Singapore and this one was by far best. We tried the Tiffin Room for dinner which we loved, although it was very expensive indeed. Raffles we will be back! Constructive feedback -

title: The complete package and service in Singapore
desc: Fantastic hotel, amazing service and staff.
